MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 02:12 PM
The Klingon looked up from where he was sat upon the floor and immediately gave Dianna a snarl, bearing his very ugly teeth. He sprang to his feet and marched towards the holoshield. "What have I done this time, Federation? You accuse me of everything. Abusing woman, killing others, ha! It is all wrong and when you realise? You shall suffer the consequences." (edited)
ob2lander961 12-Nov-19 02:20 PM
"Yeah, I'm not the one behind bars on a federation flagship."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 12-Nov-19 02:21 PM
[Capri] "Rather difficult to throw out consequences from behind a force field, isn't it?"
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 02:21 PM
"You think that I am without allies. I have allies out there, powerful allies, allies who would be more than happy to collect your head for my collection."
ob2lander961 12-Nov-19 02:23 PM

MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 02:24 PM
"Powerful enough kill you and your friends."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 12-Nov-19 02:24 PM
[Capri] He raised an eyebrow and shook his head, "And yet I'm still not scared..."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 02:26 PM
The Klingon snarled and punched the holoshield, but as it flickered it hit him with a jolt of electricity and he had to wrench his hand away - his hair even went a bit static.
ob2lander961 12-Nov-19 02:27 PM
"Smart. So if your friends are so powerful why don't they come hear and free you. It can't be that hard"
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 12-Nov-19 02:28 PM
[Capri] "Maybe it means they'd have to actually think about something besides their bat'leths for once,"
ob2lander961 12-Nov-19 02:30 PM
"Probably, I bet this one was so drunk the guards just let him in."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 02:30 PM
He laughed darkly and shook his head. "How do you not know, Starfleet, that my allies are not already here?"
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 12-Nov-19 02:33 PM
[Capri] He raised an eyebrow and looked over at Davis. "This is stupid, can't we just beat the answers out of him?"
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 02:34 PM
"Go ahead, petaQ! I will gladly use an opportunity to fight you!" He grinned and cracked his knuckles. In the background, the ship shook slightly from being at slipstream for so long.
ob2lander961 12-Nov-19 02:37 PM
"We know exactly where your friends are, the tachyons, all of it. There is no point of keeping them safe"
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 02:38 PM
He raised a bushy eyebrow. "Ha. Like you could find their location."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 12-Nov-19 02:38 PM
[Capri] "It really wouldn't take much."
ob2lander961 12-Nov-19 02:41 PM
"It didn't take much" she eyed King trying to give him the hint "We have them isolated."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 02:42 PM
"...Is that why your ship is moving, then?" He questioned. "To hunt them down?" (edited)
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 12-Nov-19 02:42 PM
[Capri] He shut up and looked back, suddenly realising they were moving.
ob2lander961 12-Nov-19 02:45 PM

MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 02:48 PM
"Is that so? Here's a hint for you, Starfleet..." He surged forwards to bang his fist against the holoshield, giving them a dark, dark grin. "If you're headed away from Qo'noS then it means you're going the wrong way."
ob2lander961 12-Nov-19 02:49 PM

Lt. JG. Copernicus King 12-Nov-19 02:55 PM

Captain Syrezeaju 12-Nov-19 02:57 PM

pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 02:59 PM
"And we couldn't send an away team.....why exactly?"
ob2lander961 12-Nov-19 03:00 PM
"Frankly, sir, the investigation is more important than a bunch of civilians." she sounded irritated
Captain Syrezeaju 12-Nov-19 03:02 PM
[Comms] "There are hundreds of lives at risk here. I don't like the situation either, but... What's that Vulcan saying? The one about the needs of the many. You get what I mean."
pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 03:04 PM
"That trail will just get colder the longer we dick around." He walked off to another side of the brig, grumbling. "May as well go get him ourselves at this rate..."
ob2lander961 12-Nov-19 03:06 PM
"I told you what could happen if Mr. Giles gets captured, it could mean interstellar war. The needs of the many do indeed out way the needs of the few. The colony is the few..."
Captain Syrezeaju 12-Nov-19 03:08 PM
[Comms] "We're almost at Corinthus X already. We have to think about the present as opposed to what could happen in the future. The Borg are here, right now, and we're not going to stand by and let hundreds of people fall victim to them."
pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 03:09 PM
"Is she serious right now?"
Captain Syrezeaju 12-Nov-19 03:10 PM
[Comms] "Deadly serious, Petty Officer." Came her reply, having heard him through Dianna's commbadge.
ob2lander961 12-Nov-19 03:11 PM

pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 03:13 PM
He nodded and typed something on his PADD before showing it to her. The screen simply read 'I'm coming with you.'
Captain Syrezeaju 12-Nov-19 03:16 PM
[Comms] "That's a negative, Davis. We don't have time for this; you're too far out from Qo'noS now. You can resume your investigation when we get back..."
pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 03:17 PM

Captain Syrezeaju 12-Nov-19 03:18 PM
[Comms] "That's my worry, but if it is, then we'll just have to face the consequences."
ob2lander961 12-Nov-19 03:21 PM

pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 03:22 PM
Capri shook his head again, snarling a little and whispering, "What the hell is going on on this ship?"
Captain Syrezeaju 12-Nov-19 03:22 PM
[Comms] Her tone lowered. "Don't do this, Commander. You don't even have time. We had to use the slipstream drive to get here so quickly..."
ob2lander961 12-Nov-19 03:25 PM

pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 03:26 PM
He nodded and ran out after her.
Captain Syrezeaju 12-Nov-19 08:09 PM
[D] The Borg drones were beamed directly to the brig, locked away inside a forcefield.
Captain Syrezeaju 12-Nov-19 08:34 PM
[D] Torghn had also been beamed back in earlier and was now in a holding cell. He kept looking to the one which held the Borg, admittedly looking terrified in the fear that they would break out.
[D] Numerous security officers had been posted alongside the two regular brig staff, just in case anything happened. Right now they were watching the drones and tapping at the forcefield like a kid tapping at a tank in an aquarium.
pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 10:02 PM
He walked in and looked at the cells holding the drones and Torgle, looking at the personnel tapping the forcefield. "Do you really think that's a good idea?"
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 10:03 PM
He was huddled at the back of his own cell, watching the the security officers across the way. "They've been doing this for an hour... Idiots..."
Captain Syrezeaju 12-Nov-19 10:05 PM
[Brig Officer] "We ain't doing any harm... Don't you think they're kinda cool? All. Robotic an' all... Awh well. We'll leave em be... C'mon guys, that's enough now." The security officers all gave irritated mumbles that they had to stop the one entertaining thing and then backed off.
pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 10:07 PM
"If its so idiotic, why are you all the way in the opposite corner? I figured those drones would be some of your friends.....Torgle." He didnt respond to the security personnel, though seeing the drones put a small scowl on his face. (edited)
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 10:10 PM
"That is not my name," he snapped. "I am a councilman and I demand to be treated with more respect!"
pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 10:13 PM
"Awwww, you don't feel respected? Would you feel better if you could address your new friends properly?" He nodded to the cell with the drones. (edited)
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 10:14 PM
The Klingon had started to shuffle forwards but then had actually flinched and moved backwards again when Capri had suggested the drones. "That... Isn't necessary."
pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 10:16 PM
"Are you sure? I bet they would loooove for you to join them," His smirk grew a little as he leaned against the console.
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 10:18 PM
"You wouldn't. That's immoral! Starfleet wouldn't condone it!"
pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 10:20 PM
"I highly doubt you, of all beings, have any room to discuss morality, Torgle."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 10:26 PM
"That is not my name," he snarled again and flicked his hair over his shoulder... But he still looked more meek than threatening. "What do you want, petaQ?"
pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 10:29 PM
He idly tapped on his PADD then looked up, playing stupid. "Im sorry, what? Youll have to forgive me, im a little hard of hearing you see..."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 10:31 PM
The klingon huffed and lunged forwards. He hit the holoshield with his hands, face a mere inch away from it. "I said what do you want, petaQ?!"
pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 10:35 PM
"Careful now. You wouldnt want to upset your new friends now, would you? Theyre a bit like earth wasps you see..." He took a few steps to the forcefield, "Perfectly alright so long as you dont make any sudden noises or movements. But one wrong move....." He stepped up close to the forcefield and snarled, "And they swarm without regret or abandon."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 10:36 PM
He hit the forcefield once more, but then stalked backwards further into the cell again. It was hard to tell if he looked angry, dejected, both...
pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 10:44 PM
"Baktag. You think im afraid of a worm like you?" He growled in Klingon, narrowing his eyes as he continued. "Youre pathetic, cowardly, not even fit to lick the dirt off of Starfleet boots." (edited)
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 10:46 PM
"Once I get out of this cell I will strangle you with my own hands. I will cut you open with your own kitchen knives and rip out your insides. I will feed your organs to the dogs, I will make sure no one knew you ever existed..."
pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 10:48 PM
"Too late. According to Starfleet, I'm already dead. Besides, if you get out then I'll have to set your new Borg friends free as well,"
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 10:51 PM
"Already dead, yet I see you alive and well, standing right in front of me... It would be fun to torture you... Like we did to your friend." He gave the slightest of smirks at the end, clearly pleased with himself.
pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 10:56 PM
"I KNEW IT!" He cried then took a step back, "Besides how can you torture someone from a borg alcove? I bet you wouldlook quite spiffy with all those neat implants," He grabbed his PADD and sent a message to Davis, figuring Talos wasnt concerned with it. ' @ob2lander961 . Torgle mentioned torturing Giles. Come to brig when available.' (edited)
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 11:05 PM
He had frozen at Capri's exclamation, realising what he had just said. Awh. Shit.
pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 11:06 PM
His voice went low, he stepped up close with a threatening glare as he pulled out his phaser. "Where is he, baktag?"
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 11:07 PM

pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 11:10 PM

pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 11:23 PM
"No. But we do what we must." He tapped another button and a piercing noise flooded into the brig. It wasnt enough to cause severe injury but definitely enough to be painful and get the point across.
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 11:25 PM
The councillor doubled over, clamping his hands over his ears. The let out a snarl of klingon swears, glaring at Capri... He may have been an abusive, slimy git; but he was no coward, and he wasn't going to give up too easily though.
pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 11:26 PM
Capri raised an eyebrow and muted the audio feed, taking a step back and leaning against the desk again. "Where is he?"
He tapped a few keys in the console and the noise stopped.
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 11:28 PM
Torghn gasped, trying to put a hand to the forcefield to steady himself but naturally it just jolted him. He couldn't hear what Capri had asked - all he could hear was ringing in his ears now.
pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 11:29 PM
He turned the audio feed back on after the noise stopped and typed on the PADD, 'Where is he?'
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 11:30 PM
"Not. Telling. You." He growled out, glaring at Capri from behind the shimmering forcefield.
pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 11:31 PM

MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 11:31 PM
"Be my guest..." The councillor said, but he looked terrified that Capri would go ahead with it. His expression easily betrayed his actual emotions.
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 12-Nov-19 11:32 PM

MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 11:33 PM

MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 11:35 PM
"I-I have allies. Powerful allies. Allies who could kill you - or could help you, be your allies too... Come on Mr Starfleet, you're too good for them, join me instead..."
pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 11:35 PM
"I dont care about your allies. I care about finding my friend."
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 11:38 PM
Torghn gave a dark chuckle. "If there's one thing I'm good at, Starfleet, it's keeping my secrets. I have no reason to tell you anything."
pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 11:38 PM

He paused, looking a bit confused... That was actually a good question.

pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 11:42 PM

MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 11:43 PM

pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 11:44 PM

MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 11:44 PM

Ensign Alyx Morgan 12-Nov-19 11:46 PM
He entered the brig swiftly, wearing civ clothing, holding a primed phaser rifle, looking for any threats, and an Intel officer, of which he found the latter. “King, what are you doing?” He enquired, as 4 security officers entered behind him. The 4 he kicked out.
pinknblackoala 12-Nov-19 11:50 PM
He looked over when the text came up and looked at Zanmar, sighing a little. "Nothing. Sir. I was just leaving." He holstered his phser and glared hard at Torghn before leaving, not giving Zanmar a second look as he walked out.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 12-Nov-19 11:50 PM
He looked at the four officers. “Follow him.” He ordered.
Captain Syrezeaju 12-Nov-19 11:51 PM
[D] The officers immediately scrambled to go after King.
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 11:51 PM
"My saviour!" The Klingon called to Zanmar. "I'm glad to know that some of Starfleet are civilised..."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 12-Nov-19 11:52 PM
He walked up to Torghn. “What was he doing?” He asked politely, as he powered down his rifle, slinging it over his back. (edited)
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 11:52 PM
He paused, a smile flickering upon his face. "...What do I get if I tell you?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 12-Nov-19 11:53 PM
“Recommendation. Recommendation as per your co-operation of my enquiries.”
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 11:54 PM
"I don't fully understand what you're trying to say, Starfleet..."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 12-Nov-19 11:55 PM
“I am saying...” He said, stepping closer. “...That I would put a note on your record stating you are co-operative with civil attempts at questioning. It will help your trial.” He stated honestly.
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 11:57 PM
"Your officer there used some unconventional methods. He used that panel over there to emit this high-pitched screech..."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 12-Nov-19 11:59 PM
He walked over and looked at it, actually scowling. “Do you currently require any medical attention?” He asked, looking back at Torghn part-way-through his sentence. (edited)
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 12-Nov-19 11:59 PM
"Ha. You really think a Klingon warrior could be harmed by such a... Pathetic little device?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 13-Nov-19 12:01 AM
“I am required as per protocol, my duty of care, and my conscience to ask.” He stated honestly, walking back over to him.
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 13-Nov-19 12:02 AM
"I require nothing."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 13-Nov-19 12:03 AM
He nodded, acknowledging what he said. “Do you have any more information on that Intelligence officer’s actions?”
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 13-Nov-19 12:04 AM
"Just that he's violent and desperate. Not Starfleet's usual sort..."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 13-Nov-19 12:07 AM
“Considering his history, I agree.” He said, seemingly now thinking if he could actually do anything. “Would you consider what he did to you assault?” He enquired.
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 13-Nov-19 12:09 AM
He contemplated for a moment. On the one hand he could take down one of Starfleet's pathetic officers... But on the other it would severely damage his pride if he classed that as assault.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 13-Nov-19 12:11 AM
He waited for a second. “Allow me to rephrase that enquiry. Would you consider what he did to be against your civil rights as a prisoner of Starfleet and the United Federation of Planets?”
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 13-Nov-19 12:11 AM
"Well... I suppose, yes."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 13-Nov-19 12:12 AM
“And can I confirm that he attempted to force you into answering questions via that noise?”
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 13-Nov-19 12:12 AM
"That's correct, yes."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 13-Nov-19 12:13 AM
“And did he threaten you in any way other than with that noise?” (edited)
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 13-Nov-19 12:14 AM
"He threatened to let your... Pets-" he pointed to the borg drones in the other holding cell "-free so they could attack me."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 13-Nov-19 12:15 AM
He glanced over at them, before looking back. “That is all I needed...” He said, before tapping his commbadge.
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 13-Nov-19 12:18 AM
The Klingon smiled and slinked back further into his holding cell. It would appear that his slip up earlier had been forgotten about.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 13-Nov-19 12:22 AM
The call ended and he turned his attention back to Torghn. “Mind explaining why your name was written in blood in quarters 14-A?” He asked rather casually. Clearly, he was the good cop in comparison. (edited)
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 13-Nov-19 12:22 AM
"It was?" He questioned.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 13-Nov-19 12:23 AM
“It was.” He stated in return.
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 13-Nov-19 12:23 AM
"I have no idea about that. Sorry..."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 13-Nov-19 12:24 AM
“And do you have any information on the occupants of said quarters?”
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 13-Nov-19 12:25 AM
"Nope..."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 13-Nov-19 12:27 AM
“Okay. By the way, I doubt you were told this, but during the inevitable questioning that will occur off this vessel, we will be able to tell if you are lying. It is harmless, but I am simply stating that so you know. We Starfleet people, Federation citizens, even, like to give people better odds legally if they co-operate and tell the truth when questioned.”
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 13-Nov-19 12:29 AM
"There's really no fun in telling the truth though..." His smile suddenly turned dark, and for a moment, he looked a lot smarter than he had previously appeared to be. "And besides... Not telling the truth means I can drag things like this out... Create a distraction... Stall you."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 13-Nov-19 12:30 AM
“Well, in that case, your life will unfortunately be made harder.” He commented.
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 13-Nov-19 12:32 AM
"I look forward to seeing what you have planned for me!"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 13-Nov-19 12:35 AM
“How does a prison colony sound? But in your case, due to your inevitable charges, you would probably be kept in a cell.”
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 13-Nov-19 12:37 AM
"Either is perfectly fine with me... It's too late for you, Starfleet. What my allies will now know? It'll be enough to take you all down. You, the Republic, and all of your petty little friends. Everyone thought I was worthless, good for nothing. Just watch as my work tears the map apart, fresh for us to claim in the name of the Klingon Empire! I will be a hero, a warrior to be sung about!"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 13-Nov-19 12:39 AM
“Our personnel are trained to be loyal to the death.” He commented blandly
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 13-Nov-19 12:39 AM
"And you really think our technology can't be used to forcibly extract information? PetaQ..."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 13-Nov-19 12:51 AM
He said nothing to that, knowing he was right on that part. “Let me tell you a story.” He said, grabbing a chair and putting it in front of the cell. “There once was a race, superior to all in weaponry, and technology. They studied other species, and knew they were a threat. But, one day, they opened their doors, and let them in. And to their surprise, not all lived up to their studies, their expectations. And so, they joined The United Federation of Planets. But, not all species were no longer deemed a threat, because not all species were societally humane, or polite, or understanding, or respectful. Not all species respected the rights of all living beings...” He said, standing up. “Not all species wanted alliances, not all species realised how flawed their systems and beliefs were through evolution. But this species, the species that opened their doors to Humans, Vulcans, Andorians, Ferengi, and all other Federation citizens, all other ‘PetaQ’, knew that one day, one day those species who failed to evolve into a civilised people would either realise their mistakes, or get themselves terminated trying. People with your mindset, your beliefs, your twisted, un-evolved, immature way of thinking. Your people will eventually evolve, but unfortunately for the rest of us, your people are slow.” He said, not once raising his own voice, before starting to walk off a little as he spoke. “But, I know not all Klingons are as likely to get themselves killed as you, as likely to end up making themselves...” He turned to face the Klingon. “Extinct. In fact, one of those is onboard, one of those served on the Enterprise, one of them serves on almost every vessel and station in Starfleet, because they know, as much as they are a Klingon, that they value other life, and can restrain their primal urges, unlike you, and your pathetic excuse for ‘allies’.” He said, now only mere inches from the brig field.
MCPO. Eshen'strars Houston 13-Nov-19 12:55 AM
The Klingon had watched and listened, intrigued... Smiling as Zanmar's tale got darker. "I must just be one of those primal ones, then." He turned away, but the smirk was still evident in his tone. Maggie looked at him. “No...I would never go that far. I’ve just screwed up....big time. I nearly beat a man to death...he could be dead as we speak because of me. He might never see his family again because of me....” She turned away to look at the ceiling
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 16-Jan-20 01:13 PM
"You nearly beat a man to death. He might never see his family again because of you. You want worse, ensign? You want to know what screwed up really looks like? I've served in Starfleet for a decade and a half now, and six in the Benthan Guard. You think you've done something horrible? I've seen worse. Way, way worse."
irishgaming1 16-Jan-20 01:17 PM
“Yes mister jessie”
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 16-Jan-20 01:17 PM
Maggie pondered that for a moment. He did bring up a very good point...in the grand scheme of things what she had done wasn’t all that bad. She stayed quiet.. decided not to answer the question verbally.. instead giving a nod of understanding
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 16-Jan-20 01:22 PM
"New Talax, Cozy little neighbourhod of Talaxians, nice people all around, upstanding citizens all. All Talaxians are for the most part. And then,... there was this Kazon. Maje Juul. Tall, ugly, smelly.. and cruel. Every day, he'd go down to that colony and demand food from them. Each time they refused to pay up, he took one of their kids and shot 'em through the head. In front of their parents." He said, completely deadpan.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 16-Jan-20 01:23 PM
Maggie looked visibly disgusted... what she did was bad, but at least she hadn’t shot a child and demanded the parents give them food. “That’s.... horrible.”
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 16-Jan-20 01:25 PM
"Wanna know the best part? He'd take whatever remained of that kid and dash it on the ground. Smear their blood on the road. He did this for twelve wbole years." He growled. "Until I caught him. We walked the streets - the smell was just awful." (edited)
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 16-Jan-20 01:26 PM
Maggie looked him in the eyes. And simply said. “Thank you... Lieutenant. For telling me that... that alleviates some of the sadness. But thank you very much...”
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 16-Jan-20 01:29 PM
"That's what he did. We took him into custody a couple of days later and executed him when the Benthan jury found him guilty way, way beyond reasonable doubt. Want to know what we did? We took him back to the Kazon homeworld and tracked down his family. His mother. His sister. And we shot him. In front of their very eyes."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 16-Jan-20 01:31 PM
Maggie looked at him. “I suppose.....that’s reasonable. If not just so he knew what it felt like to be killed in front of your family” She said with a hint of doubt over if that was the right thing to do. But she agreed with it nonetheless
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 16-Jan-20 01:32 PM
"Trust me. The feeling isn't pleasant. I pulled the trigger." He said, very plainly. "I heard their pleas. I watched 'em cry. And shut them out." (edited)
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 16-Jan-20 01:46 PM
Maggie looked at the Lt. Seemingly understanding where he was coming from. “Ok sir... thank you for talking to me. It was very nice of you”
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 16-Jan-20 01:47 PM
"All the three of you did was punch up a few lizard ladies and men. I've done worse. Way worse. So stop acting like you've just committed murder. Or something. Got it, ensign?"
irishgaming1 16-Jan-20 01:51 PM
“Look can you guys pipe down a bit”
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 16-Jan-20 01:55 PM

ob2lander961 04-Feb-20 03:53 AM

Captain Syrezeaju 04-Feb-20 04:04 AM
Years upon years of working aboard vessels which were largely manned by Vulcans had made Khassid rather good at emulating their attitude. In most situations she could be just as reserved and distant as them. This was one of such situations where she tried, desperately, to emulate that attitude... And failed horribly, her mind suddenly awash with her darkest memories which she had tried to suppress over the years. There it was - waking in the middle of the night, covered in blood, the agony coursing through her and what should have been her- her daughter- The colour had drained from her face and even those white scales had seemed to shift to greyscale. Instinctively, like muscle memory, an arm had crossed her lower abdomen, fingers clawing into her jacket at the other side... Somehow, she managed to snarl out “there’s no point in being unreasonable, this sort of attitude will not get you anywhere-“ but then she had to stop, biting down on her tongue at the wave of nausea. There isn’t blood on your hands, she had to mentally tell herself, there isn’t blood on your hands... Just like that night... Oh, Lord...
Agent Jennifer Ananis BOT 04-Feb-20 04:07 AM
"And Davis that's how you resurface repressed memories." She gave two claps for herself

Captain Syrezeaju 04-Feb-20 05:00 AM

ob2lander961 04-Feb-20 05:02 AM

Captain Syrezeaju 04-Feb-20 05:08 AM
“No..?” She asked. Her vision had slowly seemed to drip with red; just like the blood... “Admittedly, Lieutenant, I don’t feel particularly well either...” And somehow, she managed to keep her voice perfectly firm and sounding eloquent... Even as the room pitched entirely and she slumped against the wall, bad right leg giving in a second before the left did, sinking.
ob2lander961 04-Feb-20 05:09 AM

From there she gave what sounded like some sort of vague affirmation, a mumble of “yes, I know...” from where she was slumped against the wall, arm still closely draped over her abdomen... And then there was nothing else. (edited)
ob2lander961 04-Feb-20 05:22 AM

Captain Syrezeaju 04-Feb-20 05:25 AM
Unconsciously she clawed her nails into Davis’s shoulder, closing her eyes against another wave of nausea and the way the room threatened to pitch again as soon as she stood. “I certainly hope not...” Khassid mumbled. “They don’t deserve it...”
ob2lander961 04-Feb-20 05:28 AM

Captain Syrezeaju 04-Feb-20 05:37 AM
When she had declawed herself from Davis she inspected her fingernails, now darkened red with blood. Just like back then... The world seemed to drain to greyscale, red patterning the floor, patterning her , and no protective grasp over her stomach could stop the blood. No protective grasp could save her daughter... She didn’t want to see this, but the world couldn’t stop swirling and she was tilting... She caved into the memories without a further fight, letting the nauseating vision of the blood... And later, her daughter... Take her.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 04-Feb-20 11:50 AM

irishgaming1 04-Feb-20 12:26 PM
@Captain Syrezeaju
Captain Syrezeaju 04-Feb-20 12:28 PM
(( TW here for gore, miscarriage/stillbirth, cancer, and emotional manipulation/abuse. I’m being legitimate about this TW, please don’t read if you’re not comfortable.)) Khassid’s vision had slowly but steadily faded to black. Externally the woman was trembling, skin ashen; perhaps having given in to the exhaustion and refusal to heal from recent injuries... She gave no response to what Dunamis was saying at all, eyes glazed over and staring downwards, breathing shaky and irregular. There had been the horrid image of the past being conjured up, swirling, swirling... Refusing to leave without being addressed. ———— The officiant’s office swam to life. They had never wanted anything lavish for their wedding ceremony; they didn’t care about the details, just each other’s company. It was on shore leave on Earth, a grey and drizzly day outside, foreshadowing of the future. Everyone could have seen this coming. Two Cardassian scientists aboard the same ship... Of course they would have ended up together, despite the subspecies difference. The friends who they had chosen to be witnesses stood aside, signed the papers when required - and just like that, their bond was sealed. “Hey, Jem,” a voice stated, cutting through the mist. It was laced with false sadness, always full of deceit... She had always known, always known: but she had loved him and she let him carry on. “I’m so sorry, they’re sending me on this away mission, it’s a massive project and I’ll be gone for a few months. I know, I know; I tried to get them to send someone else but they wanted me for my experience. They wanted to send you to begin with but I told them you’re off limits! I need to get packing. I... I - you, Jem.” His words had always been fake and this time they cut out. She had ignored this for so long, so long; how he had vanished a month before it happened. How had he known..? Was the new question, but her vision was swirling again.
There was a familiar jolt of fear, one that she had felt so many times before despite trying to forget, and her eyes snapped open. The once-feral little kitten that she had tamed stood next to her head, meowing, licking at her face and batting her with its paws - desperate for her to wake. As soon as she did, the pain hit. It tore through her abdomen and in an instant she was choking back the sobs. She staggered upright and fumbled for their bedside light, other hand clutching at her midsection... and when she switched it on, all she could see was red. The bedsheets were patterned with it, her bedclothes were stained... ‘No. No. Not- Please-‘ was all she could think as she just managed to hit her commbadge and alert medical, before collapsing back down once more... Red stained into her vision. From there the images kept swirling: mutters of “we’ll have to induce her,” “I’m so sorry, Commander,” “Jem? Jem! What’s happened?” “Your little girl...” She was desperate not to watch but it kept coming, and then the view skipped forwards, the same voice as in the other dreams conjuring up a memory that wasn’t as well suppressed. “It’s called multiple- multiple- multiple myeloma...” It echoed... And then there was a “Goodbye, Jem,” the image of him turning out of her hospital room; never to be seen again... And then there was nothing but the red still stained into her vision and the black void beneath it. (edited)
6

How had he... How had he known..?

You have minimal access to ship files and quite frankly, how can you predict a sudden anomaly before it even occured.? And like sara said, Racism is not freedom it is the destructor of freedom. If you have the freedom of speech then use it wiseley. I know that you have it, that is why I have been taking your thoughts into consideration this whole time, i also have the freedom of speech which allows me to ask you to be quiet when we are currently discussing important matters." (edited)
Schrodinger's Oliver 22-Mar-20 03:23 AM
"And what do you suggest I do?" (edited)
Deleted User 22-Mar-20 03:24 AM
"You have the right to remain silent, use it." (edited)

Schrodinger's Oliver 23-Mar-20 05:51 AM
He sat down on his bed
Schrodinger's Oliver 23-Mar-20 08:57 AM
He sighed and stood up, recognizing the cell was muted, he waved his arms, trying to attract attention.
Schrodinger's Oliver 23-Mar-20 11:31 AM
Every hour or so, he’d get up and repeat. Each time the wait would be longer and he did it with less and less energy.
Schrodinger's Oliver 23-Mar-20 11:51 AM
Syth sat down and sighed. He was exhausted, dehydrated and hungry. He had water from the fosset over the sink, but he wasn’t going to give his jailers the pleasure of watching him drink like a animal. He looked over and saw Jayne, once again in a trance, most likely just waiting for him to do something and get him in trouble again. He really wasn’t liked here. He just didn’t get it, everything he has done so far was commended by his peers at the academy, yet now it is only getting him punished. He began to get angry, as he realised that he was no longer better, or even equal to his peers. He instantly regretted the wave of emotion. He came to a conclusion; he is going to be the best officer Starfleet has ever seen. He would work hard at whatever he gets assigned to do, and after his probation, he will appeal to the Captain for his old rank back. He felt that feeling inside of him he enjoyed, that feeling of being in control. Then as quickly as it came, it left. He realised none of that could happen if he didn’t get anything to eat. He once again stood up and signalled to the frozen hologram, wishing these cells didn’t have a mute feature in the first place.
Schrodinger's Oliver 23-Mar-20 12:23 PM
He moved over to the connection between the field and the wall. He figured if he could find a semi-loose bolt, he may be able to gain computer access and disable the field- only for a bit. He would just grab something to eat out of the replicator.
He found a lose one, and after finally checking to make sure there was no one there (Besides Jayne of course, standing there, as frozen as ever) he slowly began to wind it counter-clockwise. It was tough, even for his improved strength due to him being Vulcan.
After some minutes, he finally loosened the bolt enough for him to quickly spin it off. He peeled back the panel, and found the two wires he was looking for. He severed them using the panel’s sharp edge as a knife. This dropped the Force field as the circuit was broken. Not knowing how much time he had, he zipped to the other side of the room, almost running into the replicator. He requested three items. “Plomeek Soup, Water, 4 degrees C and a PADD”. he wasn’t sure if the last item would work, but sure enough one materialised infront of him. Holding everything, he dashes back over to his cell and dumps it on his bed. He then connects the two wires back together and knots it off. He replaced the panel, leaving the bolt loose. It might prove useful later.
He enjoyed his soup, as he attempted to create a new account for the ships’s Chatroom- he needed some form of entertainment.
he finally concluded the name ‘sexyrabbit’ couldn’t be drawn back to him and he created the account.
He smiled to himself as he begins to understand what slang these peopled used.
He found this amusing and enjoyable. His sentence should whizz past with this.
Schrodinger's Oliver 23-Mar-20 12:50 PM
He stashes the PADD beneath his pillow. Exhausted, he passes out almost instantly, half hanging off the bed.

Admiral Phenna Ephrix BOT 24-Mar-20 09:42 PM
With the psy-null device active and locked away behind the holofield which had finally been muted to all outside noise, Phenna had absolutely no idea that someone was there until Clark had spoken. This position with back against the wall, sat upon the floor seemed to have become the norm - like a meditative place, reflective. Despite that, though, self-imposed isolation apparently had not done wonders for the admiral; skin pale, almost trembling. Eyes snapped open at the sound of Clark's voice - not like she could see, but it was more down to instinct than anything - and she looked in his direction almost immediately. "Correct, he was stripped of his rank after the assault charges. Along with Valdain, 3 of his so called 'henchmen' were arrested and also brought back down to new Romulus around the same time as Valdain himself. Other than that, no reported brig cases for the past 2 weeks, besides from John Ferentz." (edited)
Nebtadjeser 26-Mar-20 02:29 AM
Kolorf nodded, making notes in his own PADD "Excellent.. All in all, with everything on New Romulus considered, it could have been a lot, lot worse. Excellent work, to you and the team."
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 26-Mar-20 02:31 AM
"We try our best commander, I greatly appreciate your words." She smiled. "Yet, like I said before, there is always room for improvement."
Nebtadjeser 26-Mar-20 02:33 AM
He thinks for a few seconds then nods "You were talking of a few improvements you had thought of for the brig. Care to share?"
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 26-Mar-20 02:40 AM
"Well moreless the standard feeding protocols as well as some minor improvements when it comes to the technology inside the brig cells. For one, I have noticed that a lot of what is being served to our residents is plated on glass. As shown in the brig recordings, that glass is easily broken and can be used to hurt people. Simply changing the brigs replicator to produce plastic plating, for example, cups and cutlery would be better for the safety of both the guard and the resident living in the cell. As for technology, during Syths time in the brig, we have seen him unscrew the bolts on one of the panels, trying to rewire it so that he could do whatever he could to get out of the cell." She tapped on the panel and brought up video recording of Syth unscrewing and rewiring the panels. "I believe, that with such technological advancements happening everyday on this ship, that there should be a way to prevent such a thing from happening. Finally, for the safety reasons involving the respect for the people in the brig, I suggest we fit each cell with a foam like padding. To prevent any sort of injury that might be caused from, Falling or self inflicted harm."
Nebtadjeser 26-Mar-20 02:46 AM
Kolorf listened quietly, nodding here and there and taking extensive notes on his PADD. "All excellent points Ensign, although there is one I would like to improve a little further upon, this one being the plates. Now glass is quite dangerous, but plastic can be just as deadly, if one can break it and use the shard. I would suggest plastic cuttlery, but cardboard-based platings. As for everything else, I'll make sure those improvements make their way to Engineering to get their approval ASAP."
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 26-Mar-20 02:49 AM
"Agreed, or we can implement rubber plating, cardboard is also a choking hazard, if someome is smart enough to utilize its malleability, when it comes to rubber, its less of a hazard. As well as one final thing, when in a cell with another brigmate, I suggest that one does not brig a phaser in there with them." She pulls up the last scene where Syth nerve Pinches jesse and takes his phaser. "If one were to have a phaser, it would be the one behind the guard without it."
Nebtadjeser 26-Mar-20 02:52 AM
"This could still be quite dangerous and lead to a hostage situation, depending on the race of the prisoner and the security officer. I would suggest only sending someone of equal or superior strength whenever we have to enter the cells."
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 26-Mar-20 02:54 AM
"Or we can eliminate the potential threat entirely and try to develop a sequence were we can section out a part of the forcefield to where we can slide the food under and close it immediately after serving it."
Nebtadjeser 26-Mar-20 03:07 AM
"A good point Ensign, but what if we need to change the prisoner to another cell? We cannot always stun them, I would rather we not abuse this power."
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 26-Mar-20 03:10 AM
"We would just use standard procedure to move them to another cell. I am just saying that we should not be distracted by the simple things, like carrying plates and keeping our guards down while we serve them to the prisoners."
Nebtadjeser 26-Mar-20 03:31 AM
"Agreed." He said, before pausing for a moment, studying the hologram. "I must admit, Ensign, I am thoroughly impressed with your work. You've been doing quite well, and you've kept improving yourself without trying to alter your programing. That shows great maturity on your part."
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 26-Mar-20 03:41 AM
"Thank you commander. I guess that you have helped a lot with that matter, if it weren't for you, I wouldn't have met my girlfriend who has helped boost my confidence." She smiled.
Nebtadjeser 26-Mar-20 03:45 AM
"No, I simply gave you a slight push. You did the rest Ensign. Yourself. I'm proud of the officer you're becoming, and I'm proud to have you on my team."
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 26-Mar-20 03:47 AM
"Thank you, commander. I really appreciate your words." She was overfilled with Joy. "It means so much."
Nebtadjeser 26-Mar-20 03:55 AM
He nodded with a genuine smile "Of course, I do expect you to keep up with this attitude and drive. Maybe someday you'll get your own posting as Chief of Security."
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 26-Mar-20 03:58 AM

Nebtadjeser 26-Mar-20 03:59 AM
Kolorf chuckled and nodded "And I am glad to have you on board with us, Ensign. Now, was there anything else you needed my assistance with?"
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 26-Mar-20 04:02 AM

Nebtadjeser 26-Mar-20 04:04 AM
He nodded before looking back at her "No Ensign. Thank you for this briefing. Have a good day, and do not overwork yourself too much." He said, nodding to her before sliding his PADD back in his pocket, turning and heading toward the exit, arms behind his back.
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 26-Mar-20 04:05 AM

We have decided to change the habits of serving food to our prisoners. Instead of glass we decided to use plastic or rubber. Plastic cutlery and cups, rubber plates. All to keep the prisoner safe in his or her cell."

Admiral Phenna Ephrix BOT 27-Mar-20 10:00 AM
Despite the circumstances the Admiral had taken solace in Doctor Dev Clark's care: the blankets he had provided were more than helpful at staving away the cold of the brig. Unaware that anybody was there until the holofield's mute was lifted and she heard Mayer speak, she looked to the general direction of the voice. The Admiral seemed washed out, pale; the ashy colour that had tinged the roots of blonde hair seeming to stand out, denobulan facial ridges creating shadows that made her seem gaunt. It was if the horror of what herself and Kennox had done had turned her into a ghost... But the usual smile remained - forced, perhaps, but it was impossible to tell - and hazy eyes swirled with stars as always. "Don't worry about calling me 'sir,' sweetheart; nobody ever does," a lilting accent replied. It was hard to place: distinctly an Earthen accent, but vague. Welsh? Hebridean? "You can just call me Phenna. And as for what happened? I'm afraid it may take quite a while to explain it all..."
SeniorChef 27-Mar-20 10:41 AM
"Thanks, but I'll stay with the formal version Admiral", he said, not really returning the smile. "And time is relative, if you have a brig shift. So if you don't mind at all just start with the story, tell whatever you're feeling comfortable telling me and I may add some questions, Sir. Anything I can serve you before starting", he asked politely, still with a serious face. It was hard to imagine, that this Person was a Starfleet Admiral once and he was looking forward to hear the story.
Admiral Phenna Ephrix BOT 27-Mar-20 10:52 AM
"You sound as if you're going to make an attempt to counsel the counsellor, sweetheart," she replied and did sound legitimately amused. "And where to begin... There is background for the background of the background of this explanation I'm afraid; it really is quite a tale when you piece it all together. The easy explanation is that I was controlled - by my nephew, unfortunately, may the universe have mercy on him - into initiating this ship's self-destruct sequence."
SeniorChef 27-Mar-20 11:01 AM
"Well there is nothing bad about expanding his horizon. Counseling someone could be an interrogation strategy for later prisoners", he told her, first time smiling during the conversation. "And your nephew.. Did he control you with some sort of technique or a device, or did he just convinced you, that it was necessary to do it, by manipulating you with fake facts, Sir", Lucas asked. He raised his eyebrow. I can hardly imagine, that a nephew of a Starfleet Admiral developes such a hate, that he attempts to destroy one of our vessels. Were there any souls on board? Did he try to kill a specific person?"
Admiral Phenna Ephrix BOT 27-Mar-20 11:13 AM
"How many souls? 1400; including your own unless you have only just come aboard. As for control: a technique, previously used by my own counterpart from the Mirror Universe in order to slowly reign havoc over the entirety of the Alpha Quadrant. You might remember it happening; the evacuation of a village, to a town, to a region, to talk of evacuating an entire country. Telepaths from Earth to the edge of the Alpha Quadrant being controlled and manipulated like puppets to use as telepathic relays..."
KardasXRT 27-Mar-20 11:15 AM
"...including throwing my best friend around like a puppet. Still gives me nightmares." The voice came from the doorway while the Jem'hadar stepped back in to check on the prisoners before going off shift. "Glassy eyes, soulless screaming. You do not want a Klingon used as a bludgeon against you."

'Throwing my best friend around like a puppet; still gives me nightmares'... And all of that had been caused by her whilst in a desperate struggle to stop it all. Just when she had thought it was all over and things had settled down, as well; now Kennox had... Snapped. And she hadn't stopped it. Things truly weren't going well, were they..?

Oskar had entered a while ago but had just made himself scarce until he was needed. Though he felt like he wouldn't be, given they were both telepaths.

Dalsh Peng BOT 15-May-20 12:06 AM
a static noise would come from the translator. The Breen tilted his head. "What happened" Then came a short pause "to the ship." His voice sounding like it came from hell itself. Corrupted and mangled, like really bad pitched radio talkshows that sound like they came from the depths.
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 15-May-20 12:07 AM
"You won't be seeing that ship for a while, bud." His face was completely neutral but that warm smile suddenly appeared. "How are you doing?"
Dalsh Peng BOT 15-May-20 12:08 AM
"Suffering, confined. Just like I was back there." He said, his breathing sounding like deep and dark fan noises
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 15-May-20 12:10 AM
"Just like back there? You're going to have to give me a little insight." He would prod, using his hands to cushion a plop to the floor. They can see eye to eye on this. A good start.
Dalsh Peng BOT 15-May-20 12:12 AM
"You brought me here" His breathing was heavy. And judging by his posture, he was very weak. "To find out why the Breen, my people, are attacking your people" He tilted his head up, his masking meeting Kuns gaze. "Or are you here to sentence me to death, for what you call "My crimes against your people" "
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 15-May-20 12:15 AM
"I'm here to help you. When we get back to my people, they're not going to have any mercy for you. But I'm giving you that now - I just need to know the full story." His voice was rather sincere for a man who should've been much harsher. Yet, after years of learning how people work, he shouldn't be so quick to scold with something like this.
Dalsh Peng BOT 15-May-20 12:21 AM
"My name is Peng," You could hear the static coughs coming from the translator. "I served the confederacy for a long, long time. I trusted, and adored my people" He turned his head to face the wall. Grieving. "We were sent here to follow orders. Destroy the medical ships that were on course to help out the vessels that were attacked By us." He managed to stand up, wobbling everytime his left leg touched the ground. "I was the captain of the vessel that attacked you and when I saw the Medical fleet heading our way. I saw nothing but people who were trying to help innocence. I ordered my ship to turn around but what happened next set my fate in stone. My crew, the people I trusted turned their backs on me and sent me into confinement. I would either die in the ship, or die for my crimes back on my home planet."
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 15-May-20 12:25 AM
"It's alright, you can sit." See, there was always something else to the story. People were complex, even if they were a different species from you. "You did the right thing. Even if they turned on you, you made the right choice. You- Peng. Peng you tried, and I can commend you for that." Pools of green conveyed utter honesty with them. "Ultimately, they may have been died in the end, but I can give you the chance to ease the guilty conscience. Please?" In fact, the Commander did something that turned the heads of the security officers. He stood up and with no hesitation, stopped the field that locked this man in. (edited)
Dalsh Peng BOT 15-May-20 12:36 AM
"The person who attacked you, is dead. The crew and its entirety was dead long before the final attack on your vessel." He coughed and dropped to the floor "I have information, regarding a secretbase on Gallon IV that might be of use to your federation people." He tilted his head "But first, let me regroup my thoughts, ah yes. The reason why the breen crew died, lies in the body you found inside the vessel that was destroyed. Our allies gave us this enhancement drug." He coughed again, each cough basically pushing his body forward. "The confederacy thought that it was a good idea to deploy our fleet with a load of drugs accopanying us, just incase we had to board any ships." He sighed, the translator letting out a monotone hum as he did so "Sadly, they dont know what happens when we use them, because before we know it. they die almost an hour after the dose is used. They turn into savages with the power to mangle things that our people normally cant do. My crew died because of that drug. If it werent for me putting that drug in the ventilation system on the Raider. Your crew would not have survived" Thats it, he mentioned it. the drug was in him too
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 15-May-20 12:46 AM
"Yes we've encountered the anomalous toxin - but hey stay with me now, who exactly are your allies?" They really were turning savages. "I can start my medical team on something, anything to get it out of your system." He didn't have much time, whatever info this man held needed to be found out before he practically died where he was. "I- this base, tell me more about it, will you?" Kun crossed the barrier of sitting outside the cell and now sat in with him, face to face.
Dalsh Peng BOT 15-May-20 01:04 AM
"The drug doesnt escape our bodies. It consumes" He clenched his chest. "There is no cure. I did this to myself" He tilted his head "I never met them, but they are described as war mongers. They fight for everything. Their skin is dark with ridges around their head, long hair anf shuch" He was twitching his head more, and the coughs turned into growls "The base is where they work, where we got the toxins or whatever you call it from." He was clawing at the floor, seizing from time to time. "You will find your answers there, that is all that I can tell, and that is all that I know." He jumped up "The breen have an army. Those dreadnaughts you saw were simulations of what the real ones can be. And the source on why our weaponry blasted through your shields is at that base." "You do not what to see what comes next, friend" He put a glove on his arm and squeezed it tight. Kun could feel the pressure begin to build. But Peng released his grasp in time "Its my time."
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 15-May-20 01:10 AM
"The Klingons." Was all he said. Gallon IV he needed to remember that. This man risked his life for this info. As his hand gripped his arm, eyes remained completely locked. Once the hold released, the first officer stood. "I'm sorry Peng. I wish things could have gone differently for you." We could've been good friends: was what he wished to have added on. Instead, he did the man one last deed. Walking up to the a security officer, he took off their phaser. Setting it to just above stun - Kun aimed, firing a shot at the man. One thing was for sure, he wasn't going to let a good heart be taken over by something he couldn't control. He'd be able to die peacefully.

Captain Syrezeaju 16-Jun-20 10:03 PM
There was another nod and she tapped at the console once more, setting the holoshield to accept her commands from within the cell. It flickered out and she stepped over the boundary - then the shield almost instantaneously flickered back to life again. With purposeful movements she took her place in front of Aaron, sitting with legs neatly crossed. "Are you ready, Ensign Miller?"
Lt. JG. Aaron Miller 16-Jun-20 10:06 PM
Aaron repositioned himself to be kneeling in front of the Agent "Yes I am"
Captain Syrezeaju 16-Jun-20 10:19 PM
She shuffled forwards ever so slightly and then stretched both hands up, placing fingertips gently against his face, green eyes flickering closed. "My mind to your mind..." A slow exhale, concentrating on establishing the link. "Concentrate on the event. Let me see what you see. My thoughts to your thoughts..."
Lt. JG. Aaron Miller 16-Jun-20 10:30 PM
[D]The holding cell slowly swirled and swirled until the brig wasn't recognisable, and A'aehrel found herself in a corridor onboard the USS Obama, with Borg drones either side, they closed in on her, and then the scene froze, and the drones began to walk backwards, until they were back in their original locations. This time A'aehral was holding a rifle. She shot at both drones and everything faded to black. A burning Starfleet delta faded into view, and was engulfed in flames moments after. (edited)
Captain Syrezeaju 16-Jun-20 10:33 PM
"So they utilised the memory of your assimilation against you," a voice mused, but it was seemingly inside of his head instead of externally. "A tactic which is completely and utterly dishonourable and wrong. I am sorry that you have had to endure such a thing."
Lt. JG. Aaron Miller 16-Jun-20 10:38 PM

Captain Syrezeaju 16-Jun-20 10:47 PM

I can see it for myself." With the memory faded, reality seemed to come into focus once more. She removed that light touch from his face and stood once more, seemingly completely unfazed from what Aaron had shown.

Captain Syrezeaju 17-Jun-20 05:03 PM

Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 17-Jun-20 05:07 PM

Captain Syrezeaju 17-Jun-20 05:10 PM

How amusing it was that she was made to think that these ideals and thoughts and memories were good when they had only served to put her into a complete and utter state. This was not 'good' in any way. "'Good thoughts.' Do you believe, Lieutenant, that your current mental status is... 'Good'?"
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 17-Jun-20 05:14 PM

Maggies thoughts turned to Tina, god she would be so mad if she knew that Maggie had failed, was Tina working for the President? Probably...she’d be mad...
Captain Syrezeaju 17-Jun-20 05:19 PM
"I mean in the present tense, Lieutenant. What they have done to you has completely knocked you off balance. It is not fair to you, is it? You and I both know that your ideals are not in line with that of the operatives'. They showed you those images in order to sway you. The fact that you are aware of their intervention proves that their work is rather shoddy... All you have to do now is fight back against what they have shown you and understand the truth."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 17-Jun-20 05:23 PM

Captain Syrezeaju 17-Jun-20 05:31 PM
"They are very well trained. You should not blame yourself for not managing to keep them at bay; being outnumbered is a difficult situation. I am no counsellor but I do believe that they would encourage you to disregard whatever they have shown you - you know that it is wrong, anyway. There is better to the world than whatever they made you see - or re-visit."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 17-Jun-20 05:43 PM

I-I” At this point she was crying and hyperventilating at the same time. The reprogramming really seemed crappy, if emotional stress was taking it out.
Captain Syrezeaju 17-Jun-20 07:46 PM
"No one is going to harm you. This vessel is your home, is it not? I do not believe that any of its crew would wish to cause you harm in any way. The operatives may have shown you some negative images from your past, but they are not your present."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 17-Jun-20 07:51 PM

And they-they wouldn’t want to hurt me no...I-I trust everyone here, I love them....I don’t want them to go though this..” She started to hold onto her hair, not exactly pulling it. Captain Syrezeaju 17-Jun-20 08:13 PM
"That is why we require your help. The more we know about your captors, the more we can do in order to prevent them causing harm to anybody else. If you are up for it, Lieutenant, I would like to hear of what happened... Or, if it is easier, you may show me."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 17-Jun-20 08:17 PM
Maggie took deep breath's. Looking up at her with a meek nod "A-a mind meld right? You want to look into my head, and see. Yeah, yeah i can do that." Maggie tried to manage a smile, but the agent could tell it was pained
Captain Syrezeaju 17-Jun-20 08:23 PM
"Only if that is alright, Lieutenant. I will not force you to do anything that you are uncomfortable with. This is solely so I can see what they have done. It will give me a better insight into how to help you - and usually, a mind meld contains an emotional transfer. You will be relieving this burden. Even if only slightly, slightly is better than not at all."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 17-Jun-20 08:27 PM
Maggie took some more deep breath's as she looked at the agent, trying to steady herself "I consent. I consent to this, if it will help you stop them then i consent." She give her a tired nod, looking right into her eyes. "I'll be fine..."
Captain Syrezeaju 17-Jun-20 08:50 PM
With a few taps upon the panel she had the holofield set to lower and raise again at her command. She stepped over the threshold between the brig and the cell, the shield flickering up behind her once more. "You will have to see whatever they showed you once again," she stated, taking a seat in front of Maggie with legs neatly crossed. "But it will not be as painful as the last. Whenever you are ready..."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 17-Jun-20 08:53 PM
Maggie closed her eyes. Sighing as she looked at the other woman "I'm ready, start whenever you wish." Maggie focused her mind, focusing on the events of the day.
Captain Syrezeaju 17-Jun-20 08:56 PM
She inched closer ever so slightly to outstretch both hands, fingertips being lightly placed upon Maggie's face. "My mind to your mind..." She inhaled, eyes closing, creating the connection. "My thoughts to your thoughts."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 17-Jun-20 09:11 PM
[D] For the agent. The holding cell faded into nothingness. Until it was just her and Maggie sitting alone in the void, then like a water droplet falling on a lily pad. The world expanded, this time it was Starfleet medical. Once a place for peace and care under Phenna, now converted into the future of Starfleet. Maggie was beamed into the room, and immediately started fighting. Punching a officer to the floor, then another. Before being subdued by three “doctors.” Maggie then bit a officers finger. Before being forced onto the table, with the headset coming onto her head. A’aehrel’s vision would darken for a second, before she found herself in what appeared to be a mansion. Would likely only be the well off of society back in the 21st-century, there she saw a teenaged Maggie being berated by Tina (a face A’aehrel might recognize). Young Maggie went to say something, only to be hit by Tina. Current Maggie’s voice broke though. ”This was my life, nothing different about this part..”
Captain Syrezeaju 17-Jun-20 09:49 PM
"I am sorry that they made you endure your past traumas," A'aehrel's voice spoke. "What they are doing is unjustifiable. Thank you for sharing this with me. Be assured, Lieutenant, that we are going to put a stop to this and ensure they cannot do this for anyone else."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 17-Jun-20 09:59 PM
[D] A’aehrel would probably feel a nod. Then the scene changed to the same house. But of a older looking Maggie, smiling as she spoke to her mom. The two then embraced as two Starfleet officers clapped. ”Don’t know why this had to be a part of their video. I guess trying to get me to be more accepting of my mom. Since she is sleeping with the President, or at least has. I don’t know anymore.” Then, then it changed to what amounted to a motion picture slideshow. As it went back and forth between images of a blue Andorian with black hair dying. To Maggie marrying the same Andorian, with the imperium logo in the background. Maggie’s voice came though again. ”It was basically this over and over again for hours. My mom, then this. My mom, then this. It was awful. But I suppose it worked temporarily.” From there the image changed to Maggie waking up from her headset. And seemingly having a pleasant conversation with two S31 operatives. Before stepping on the transporter pad. “This is where all the details end in terms of them. Unless you want to relive me getting arrested I think we can end it here.”
Captain Syrezeaju 17-Jun-20 10:40 PM
The image greyed around the edges and then returned to reality as A'aehrel dropped the mind meld, removing the light touch she had upon Maggie's face. "...It would appear that they were more proactive this time; trying to entice people with a potential future as well as the promise of a better past. We must work to prevent future use of this tactic, lest it be used on one of your colleagues to a more successful extent than with yourself and Ensign Miller."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 17-Jun-20 10:43 PM
Maggie nodded as she gave a smile, feeling genuinely happy.. “Yeah... thank you so much. I’m sorry about getting captured in the first place.” With that she lied against the wall. “I uhm, better stay in here for a little while longer. Just in case the programming pops back...”
Captain Syrezeaju 17-Jun-20 10:57 PM
"You need not apologise for what you could not help, Lieutenant Roode," she stated whilst nimbly standing again. "Hopefully you shall be let out soon. I will leave you to rest for now." With a polite nod she requested the holoshield be lowered. She stepped out and it immediately flickered back to life again - and seconds later, she had left the brig.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 17-Jun-20 10:58 PM
