Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 18-Aug-20 08:55 AM
The Lieutenant put Maleb gently in a holding cell. "You will remain here until further notice, Ensign Maleb. I will determine the proper sentencing once the security team has contacted all the necessary authorities."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 08:57 AM
Maleb nodded, willing himself to not cry yet. "Com-commander ShiKahr. Will she be-be? My hands were shaking. I-Are you okay, sir?" Maleb didn't wait for a reply before dropping to the ground again, burying his face in his forearms as he quietly cried, though his tears could not be seen at all from outside his little bundle of limbs. (edited)
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 18-Aug-20 09:03 AM
"I am perfectly fine Ensign, it is you that I am worried about. I will be sending you a counselor for rehabilitation, as I believe that you are a loyal member to this crew and you need to realize that. For now, there is simply nothing I can do in this given moment, rather than to go about my duties as a security officer."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 09:11 AM
Maleb may or may not have heard her answer as he curled up tighter. What had he done? He was hopeless. An Ensign forever. Acto-In-Training... He could almost see the opportunity flying away from him. Would Kunzō even let him stay in Starfleet? He'd dedicated much of his short life to his career. He didn't want to become a bartender or a waste management specialist or whatever the hell he was good for (after all, he wasn't good for much). When he got kicked out of Starfleet, he'd have to go home to his Grandfather. Oh Winds. Grandfather might actually kill him. Literally. Blood and all. What would his parents say if they could see him now? They'd feel the same as if they could see him even in his day to day life. Nothing but shame. He might as well not even be an Ensign anymore. His rank was gone. His life was gone. His family... His family. Sara, T'Pel, Sa'val. Oh Winds. They'd never speak to him again. Not after what he did. To their loyal, intelligent, talented First Officer. He was alone. Again. Why did he keep doing this to himself? Why couldn't he ever do a single thing right? Everyone would be so disappointed in him. Angry, resentful, hateful. And he deserved it. He shot someone. The first officer. Winds. Winds. Winds. He didn't want to be alone again.
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 12:05 PM
Maleb was sitting in the middle of the cell, his knees to his chest with his face buried against his legs. In a desperate attempt to block everything out, his hands were over his ears, and he was rocking slightly where he sat. His mess of emotions was confusing to him. He didn't know what to do.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Aug-20 12:10 PM
"Ensign Maleb." The doors to the brig hissed open, and the Kelpien walked in - though his face was its usual craggy, impassive self. He found a regular old plastic chair from somewhere, pulled it up to his cell and sat down, where at least his eyes could be met. "I want to talk to you."
5
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 12:14 PM
It took Maleb a few seconds to react. Slowly, he dropped his hands and looked up. Four deities. Four deities. Four deities. His breathing quickened. "Comand-Commander Dunamis. Sir. I- I am sorry. I didn't mean to disappoint you. I was - no one was listening to me. She was going to k-kill Lieutenant Walsh. I didn't- I wasn't- I'm- I'm sorry." Maleb said as he tried to stand up, still too weak to succeed. Not sure of what she to do he shifted into seiza, shaking hard as his breath grew faster than seemed healthy. (edited)
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Aug-20 12:18 PM
"How did you deduce her intentions?" He questioned, sitting back in the chair which creaked a bit under his weight. Stupid plastic chairs.
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 12:21 PM
"I- I'm half B-Betazoid, sir." Maleb said, taking a few breaths to get it out. He used his sleeve to wipe his tear-stained face. "I know what- what preparing to kill feels like. It's all..." One of his hands hit the side of his head. "Last time I sensed that feeling - I-I don't want to talk ab-about it."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Aug-20 12:24 PM
"You shall not have to." Gosh, that sounded cold. "Therefore you gleaned her intentions from her mind. Did you tell lieutenant Walsh this?"
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 12:27 PM
"No... No sir... I don't know. I don't remember. I don't think so... But, uh, I know that empathy isn't illegal. Only -uhm- telepathy without consent. There's a d-difference, sir." He looked like he was approaching the verge of more tears as he tried to remember. "I'm sorry." (edited)
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Aug-20 12:40 PM
"I understand that, ensign." The poor man looked about fit to collapse into tears. He nodded to the brig officer, who brought the holoshield down for him to enter, and he sat down next to him instead. "Would you like some water? I'm sure the brig officer wouldn't mind bringing you a glass." (edited)
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 12:41 PM
Maleb recoiled sightly, shaking his head. "No, t-thank you sir. I- uhm- I don't feel very good."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Aug-20 12:47 PM
"Of course." He then proceeded to reach over with his long, slender arms and wrap them around him in a gentle hug. "Ensign, listen. I believe that if you are given to tell your side of this story, we will understand..."
3
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 12:47 PM
Maleb tensed up instantly under his grip. "Please don't touch me!"
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Aug-20 12:49 PM
"Of course." He was let go with a sigh. "The fact still remains. You have your side of the story which the others do not yet have. While it will certainly not absolve you of responsibility it will certainly help your case. Alright?"
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 12:58 PM
Maleb nodded and began stammering through his perspective. "Yes, sir. Uhm - Yes. When Commander ShiKahr walked in, I knew something was wrong. I didn't know what, but something was, sir. I could sense it. And then she ignored me. I mean -- I know she heard me, but she didn't acknowledge me when I asked her if she was ok. I put myself between the team and her and set my phaser to maximum stun. I do not know much about Romulans, sir, and I had to be sure she would be stunned in one shot. As far as I knew, I was the only one with a real weapon, and I tried to alert you to the fact that something was amiss - at the time I thought you were ignoring me too. I was getting desperate, because I could feel Commander ShiKahr approach the point of violence. Then she and Lieutenant Walsh were going to spar. I offered to be her partner, to keep the team safe, but she ignored me again. And no one was taking me seriously, even though I was certain that there was intent to spill blood. I couldn't say anything without risking everyone's safety. I mean, everyone was eating cookies, sir. I couldn't say anything overt, so I felt it was up to me. When I sensed that she was about to attempt to kill Lieutenant Walsh, I..." And he trailed off at the end, his breath catching in his throat as his voice broke slightly. "There were no other solutions without putting everyone else's safety at risk. It was too dangerous, and no one was listening or paying enough attention to me to see what I was trying to communicate covertly." (edited)
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Aug-20 01:06 PM
"Not everyone is able to discern intention at a glance, ensign." He himself felt guilty about it as well, having been munching on cookies along with the rest. He'd gleaned some of what the hybrid meant, and yet not acted upon it. He had to trust her. It was what being a Starfleet officer also entailed. Trust. Forgiveness. "I cannot say for certain that I believe that you were doing the right thing. But I do believe that perhaps it was necessary - whether or not lieutenant Walsh was within means to protect herself. In the end we shall have to hear her side of the story first - which may have to come after the battle ahead."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 01:11 PM
After the battle? No. Please no. "She t-told me, sir, that she was aware of the Commander's intentions. B-But, I can't read Androids. And she was... It only would have taken another fraction of a second for Commander ShiKahr to kill or seriously maim her, sir. Y-you must understand. The crew comes over my personal safety and career every time. I am not going to l-lie to you and say that I wasn't thinking straight. I was. It was the only logical conclusion that guaranteed the survival of all non-aggressor parties, sir." He paused. "The Commander... Will she be... My hands were shaking right after I fired. I thought my aim was sound but - Will she be okay?"
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Aug-20 01:14 PM
"She is in the good hands of our sickbay staff." was all he could say. He only wished he could offer some more substantial reassurance. "I understand that you were in the right frame of mind, and I understand that you believed it to be necessary. Nonetheless we have a larger, more dire matter ahead of us as you know. We shall have to wait and see."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 01:15 PM
Maleb nodded, also wishing for that reassurance. "Understood, sir. Ah-uh- my.. my pip, sir. Sometimes they take it away when someone's done something this bad, right, sir?"
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Aug-20 01:16 PM
"We shall see how things progress." He answered, very simply.
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 01:19 PM
Another nod, this time tinged with sadness. "I am sorry. I know that you - and the Captain, and Lieutenant Verne - you all took a chance on me. And I disappointed. I am sorry. For the inconvenience and for what I did to Commander ShiKahr and for the trouble I've caused and just for not handling the situation better. I am sorry." (edited)
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Aug-20 01:29 PM
"All of us make missteps, ensign. That is life. Sometimes more indelible, some more serious than others. Even you. Even me." A long sigh. Why wasn't he following his own advice?
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 01:34 PM
Maleb couldn't think of the right words. His brain was too fuzzy and it wouldn't do what he asked it to. Instead, looked Dunamis in the eyes, making no effort to hide the tears brimming his own. After a beat, he found something to say. "I want her to recover, emotionally and physically. I do not know what was or is wrong with her, but she deserves help. I only got a glimpse of what she felt and... It is horrible."
5
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Aug-20 01:43 PM
"I think she will, on all fronts. The process may be longer in some aspects, perhaps, but I think she will recover. And yes..." Tal Shiar, Zhat Vash. Two of the Romulans' worst black intelligence organizations. "...she deserves help, the same as any of us. She is not beyond redemption - I do not think anyone ever is."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 01:46 PM
Maleb could think of one or two people who were beyond redemption -- but that was irrelevant. "It is good to know that you believe so. Uhm- is there anything I need to clarify or elaborate on, sir?"
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Aug-20 01:54 PM
"Not at the moment, no. But come what may, ensign, this is not the end for you. Know that."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 01:56 PM
"You do not think it is? It does not matter how you tell the story -- I shot the first officer in the presence of the head of my department. If I were in a position of authority, I fear I would come to a far different conclusion than you have. It is the Captain's decision, is it not?"
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Aug-20 02:01 PM
"I don't think it is. Captain Kunzo is a reasonable man - I'm sure he will be willing to listen to your side of the story." He reached up, rubbing at his eyes. "Take heart."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 02:04 PM
The ensign nodded slightly. Deities, he felt like a tiny man stuck in a world of Titans. "That he is, sir. I... I hope he understands. Starfleet - it encompasses my job, my family, my friends. I cannot lose it. It is too important."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 18-Aug-20 02:20 PM
"Once again I understand that. I'm afraid that for now I'll have to leave, however - see you again soon, ensign." He'd have loved to stay and chat, but there were other pressing concerns and other people to tell. Standing he walked out of the cell and out of the brig, after which the holoshield once again sprung up between them.
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 02:25 PM
Maleb nodded. He didn't admit to himself that having someone to talk to made a difference to him... But it did. A massive difference. Even if they could only stay for a few minutes, a reprieve from his own thoughts was greatly appreciated. Once he was certain the Commander was gone, he moved to the strange hard bed thing that the cell had and laid on his back, staring up at the ceiling. Paranoia, fear, uncertainty, self-hatred, grief, mortal terror. Emotions he didn't know the words for swirled around him. He wanted it to be over, despite having endured it for only a few hours.
Commander T'Svai 18-Aug-20 03:04 PM
She paused in the doorway just in case there was some form of protocol she'd missed. On the K'Warko, as she'd found out during the scorpion venom incident, regulations regarding brig access were somewhat lax, but this ship could easily be different. "Is my presence here permitted?"
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 03:06 PM
Maleb looked over, not objecting. The brig officer didn't object either. The Vulcan had obviously been crying, but, at least at the moment, his face showed no emotion whatsoever. He forced himself to sit up. "Greetings." (edited)
Commander T'Svai 18-Aug-20 03:11 PM
"Greetings, Ensign." She said equally emotionlessly. "Do not feel obligated to maintain a facade. Your reaction to stunning the Commander earlier was quite clear and I am no longer under the misapprehension that your emotional control is perfectly intact." There was no judgement in her tone, nor much of anything, really. She took a few steps forward. "Do altercations of this nature occur frequently?"
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 03:14 PM
"A facade it is not, sir. I am currently in control of my emotions, and the only reason I faltered earlier is because of the specifics of the serious events that had just transpired. It is not usual for an Ensign to fire upon a Commander, if that is what you are asking, sir."
Commander T'Svai 18-Aug-20 03:20 PM
"That is a component. That the Commander seemed inclined to attack another officer is also a component, but one can extrapolate from your response that it is not, in fact, common." She corrected. "More to the point, your eyes are red and there are no irritants in the air, therefore I feel compelled to add that your reaction to the Commander's behavior was logical."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 03:22 PM
Maleb blinked a few times, suddenly self-conscious. "I am aware that it was logical. However, there is always more than one logical path. Whether I chose the correct one is not my judgement to make, sir." (edited)
Commander T'Svai 18-Aug-20 03:30 PM
"I did not say it was correct, merely that it was logical. Logic is occasionally at odds with regulation. What to do under those circumstances is often unclear and seldom paves the way for faultless decision." She remarked evenly. "It is natural to, after such decisions, begin wondering what consequences may arise. I hesitate to draw an analogy to my actions regarding the simulated thalaron grenade, but..." She waved a hand, since she really didn't want to get into that again and hopefully the context would say what needed to be said. "I am sure an analysis will reveal that your choices when presented with an equally explosive situation were at minimum well-reasoned."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 03:35 PM
"I certainly hope so, sir. Commander Dunamis rightly provided me with very little information regarding Commander ShiKahr's condition and what consequences I will face. It leaves a great deal of room for speculation. It is the Captain's decision now. I do not know Captain Kunzō well, only that he is kind, reasonable, and close with his crew. What to expect, I cannot say. Optimism is illogical."
Commander T'Svai 18-Aug-20 03:40 PM
She raised an eyebrow about as high as it would go. "Pessimism is also illogical. To recall a common saying, do not dwell in the past and do not dream on the future. What is, is."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 03:43 PM
"This is true... I suppose the amount of experience I have is insufficient. But what is there to do but plan for the future at the moment? If I lose Starfleet, I need to be prepared to tell my grandparents. That is something that must be planned in advance, for example."
Commander T'Svai 18-Aug-20 03:47 PM
"Allow me to assist. 'Dear-' And then insert the names of your grandparents here- 'I have been removed from Starfleet as a result of my decision to use a phaser on a superior officer in an attempt to protect a colleague. I will be returning home and/or in prison in/for x amount of time.'- That component can be changed as need. 'Live long and prosper.'" She suggested somewhat dryly.
5
6
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 03:48 PM
Maleb stared blankly at her. "Thank you for your input, sir."
Commander T'Svai 18-Aug-20 03:49 PM
The eyebrow lowered. "Though once again I am not under the impression that such a communication will be necessary."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 03:51 PM
"I am continually uncertain. It would be preferable to not need to pen such a message, but I do not wish to assume. My choice was neither black nor white."
Commander T'Svai 18-Aug-20 03:52 PM
She tilted her head to the side slightly. "I once shot my Captain on the K'Warko in the chest, in addition to several other colleagues, with a modified phaser on maximum stun for medical reasons. No consequences arose." Without context that of course sounded absolutely batshit crazy, but you know.
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 03:53 PM
"Our scenarios are not the same, sir. Specific circumstances are significant."
Commander T'Svai 18-Aug-20 03:54 PM
"Captain Praanor was affected by a parasite. Commander ShiKahr was affected by anger of unknown origin, itself a kind of parasite."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 03:58 PM
"In my opinion, your parallels are highly illogical, Lieutenant. I am not familiar with your specific incident, but they are different enough that this may be much more of a moral grey area. I am not even sure if I did the correct thing."
Commander T'Svai 18-Aug-20 04:02 PM
"I strongly disagree with your opinion." She retorted. "Nonetheless, you will be best served by a clear mind when called upon to present a defense of your actions and assuming failure without weighing success equally will not aid you in that. I must leave, but in the event your assessment of the impending consequences of your actions is correct, working with you on the modifications to the CTATS program was a fascinating experience."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 04:05 PM
"Perhaps I shall meditate for a time - if I can. It is satisfying to hear that you found the time that we worked together to be fascinating. Good day, Lieutenant." Deities, his first real goodbye. If he was discharged... It would be the first of many. Or the only one, depending on how hated he was on the ship. He didn't know which was worse.
Commander T'Svai 18-Aug-20 04:07 PM
Had that made the situation worse or better? She was uncertain. She contemplated saying something else, but figured she'd already said enough. "Good day, Ensign." She left the brig.
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 04:08 PM
Alone again, Maleb looked around the cell. Nope, nothing new had popped up. Back to the bed for meditation while he planned goodbyes in the back of his mind -- just in case. Just in case.
Cadet Edward Smith 18-Aug-20 04:24 PM
He entered the brig and relieved the crewmen that was on duty, and read the brief report there on the new prisoner he noticed.
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 04:26 PM
Maleb didn't acknowledge the Cadet as he came in until a few seconds later. "My name is Ensign Haitek Maleb-" he said, before getting cut off by the transmission. He stopped to listen, tilting his head slightly.
"Did they just - no. No. No. They couldn't have. It is highly illogical. Cadet, what did they just do? Did you see the video?"
Cadet Edward Smith 18-Aug-20 04:27 PM
"I did." He said with a stern glare towards the console.
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 04:28 PM
"What happened? I do not have my PADD." He asked calmly.
Cadet Edward Smith 18-Aug-20 04:31 PM
"They glassed a colony off a planet." He explained looking up to the Ensign behind the forcefield.
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 18-Aug-20 04:33 PM
"Eighty thousand innocent lives lost in a blink of an eye." She added in, watching the demonstration from her console.
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 04:33 PM
"They are destroying their own people... That is highly illogical." Maleb said, his words simple while his mind worked through everything he was hearing. "Four deities. May I have a PADD, sir?"
Cadet Edward Smith 18-Aug-20 04:40 PM
"I cannot, due to regulations sir." He informed frankly.
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 04:41 PM
Maleb sighed. He knew the answer he'd get before he asked. Still.. he'd need to look over the video ASAP, whether it was as an officer or as a civilian.
Cadet Edward Smith 18-Aug-20 04:49 PM
"They certainly enjoy stroking their ego. I have some doubts they can do that again immediately." He mentioned after replaying it a couple times.
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 04:50 PM
"Cadet, that is not stroking their ego. That is destroying tens of thousands of living people."
Cadet Edward Smith 18-Aug-20 04:52 PM
"It is also genocide. That is obvious it's why I didn't mention it. Ensign."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 04:55 PM
Maleb nodded silently. Winds, he needed to control himself. Not get in the way of the officers at their posts while he was stuck, useless, in the brig. There was work to be done. Maleb needed to be in the Hub, or doing his job at least. Urgency was pumping through his veins. Deities.
Cadet Edward Smith 18-Aug-20 05:07 PM
He continued his work despite the massive hangover that was just beginning to set in.

10
9
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 18-Aug-20 05:17 PM
Entering the brig, his eyes immediately went towards the cells. It was easy to land on the young officer with that dignifying red stripe across his chest. Long strides took him to the very front of the cell, in just a mere second or two, jaw relaxed and expression turned into concern rather than the angered look that had settled in. "You doing alright in there?" The question, although vague, was genuine.
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 05:19 PM
Maleb had been scowling in the classic Vulcan way, impatient as he felt the need to see the transmission. As soon as Kunzō appeared, however, his face turned softer. His eyes were red -- he'd almost certainly been crying. "Captain Kunzō. I can explain, sir. I do not know how much you know, but, I assure you, I did not intend to maim Commander ShiKahr. I am truly sorry, sir."
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 18-Aug-20 05:22 PM
"No, no, you don't need to apologize - you... You did the right thing. Believe it or not." Instead of choosing to remain standing, the Acamarian lowered himself to the floor to kneel. Keep the video out of your mind, keep it out. He knew for a fact that little perfected façade would crumble. "It's not my place to explain that but I know for a fact you were keeping a crewmate safe. That's why-" He reached up, and pressed the console on the wall to lower the field. "I'm letting you leave."
Cadet Edward Smith 18-Aug-20 05:23 PM
He noted in the log that the prisoner was released, by the captain. (edited)
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 05:25 PM
Maleb's eyes widened slightly. No way it was that easy. It was never that easy. "Captain, you are aware that I would never question your orders. However, are you certain that this is the decision you wish to make, sir? I do not wish to cause dissonance between you and Commander ShiKahr. Not at a time of high tension such as this, sir."
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 18-Aug-20 05:34 PM
"I need you to trust me when I say that I know this is the decision I want to make." His words were held in complete confidence. "The Commander, the Commander would have , as you said, maimed Walsh. And had it not been for your actions, I'm afraid the Lieutenant would have spent, much, much longer Engineering." "She's... she's not doing well. She's dealing with something she told me she'd take care of. I can't excuse what she did but I promise this isn't on her own volition." His eyes cast to the floor before flicking back up. "You're free to go Maleb, I'd suggest getting some actual rest. We don't have any orders now but they'll come soon which is why I'd rest up while you can."
Lt. JG. Haitek Maleb 18-Aug-20 05:44 PM
Maleb nodded, coming closer to where the force field had been. "Captain Kunzō, I do indeed trust you. Whatever influenced Commander ShiKahr, I will not hold actions inspired by it against her, sir." After a moment of hesitation, he dropped down into a low squat to be even with the Acamarian. Oh! His hair was different, wasn't it? "Thank you, sir. For everything, sir." He didn't get to speak to the Captain much, and he had wanted to say thanks for a while, since finding out he was ACTO-in-Training, and even before that for keeping his team on Hex safe. After a beat, he stood, nodded, and went into the hallway. That was surprisingly painless, he thought as he went, if not a tad awkward. But saying what needed to be said was more important than avoiding awkwardness.
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 18-Aug-20 05:47 PM
She smiled, knowing that he was let out in good terms, she knew that there would be no sentencing. But sometimes you have to let the crewman decide his own fate. In the meantime Jayne wanted to address the Captain, it was convenient that he stumbled down to the brig. "Captain, may we speak when you have the chance? In private. There is a matter I would like to discuss regarding the incident."
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 18-Aug-20 05:58 PM
"Have a good one," He had said to the now empty room as Maleb had chosen to leave. It was a moment like this that he was very glad he had chosen the Ensign for ACTO training. He had deserved it. In that small amount of time, it's almost as if he has forgotten everything that had happened. Instead, as he heard Jayne speak, he was thrown out of his own little world. Immediately, the Captain stood. "Yes of course, please, lead the way" he nodded as he motioned forward.
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 18-Aug-20 06:44 PM
Jayne nodded and left the brig. Nodding to the cadet who took her place.
Cadet Edward Smith 18-Aug-20 07:00 PM
Once everyone had departed leaving himself and an empty brig he dimmed the light twenty percent along with his console. So his hangover would bother him less.
Lt. Cmdr. Dev Clark 18-Aug-20 07:01 PM
The Captain quickly followed along.
Cadet Edward Smith 19-Aug-20 11:01 AM
He finished his shift here and departed the brig.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 25-Aug-20 10:00 PM
Despite everything that had gone on the past few days Ezran still had been working away, and now they were back at earth, he had one final job to do before they were to be given shore leave... He stepped into the brig and walked quietly down past all the holding cells until he reached his destination. "So, I guess it's time for this. I've been dreading this moment for quite some time now."
4
Captain Syrezeaju 25-Aug-20 10:10 PM
A'aehrel had absolutely despised the last few days. First she had been confined to medical and entirely unable to help despite the fact that they were headed into a war - a war with colleagues she knew, colleagues she knew how to fight. She had been entirely useless locked away and what was worse was that she understood why she had to be, considering how she had almost killed someone a little while before. It was infuriating, completely agonising, and she had despised it. Medical had burned, eventually, and as such she had been dragged here. At least within the brig she had space and relative privacy. There were no others in different holding cells at the moment and it gave her the peace and quiet to meditate whereas medical was always filled with the continuous beeping of machines and chatter of staff and patients alike. With this in mind she had been sat upon the floor, cross-legged, when that familiar voice spoke - muted a little by the holoshield in front of them. There was a slow and of course irritated exhale and then she cracked one eye open. "I presume I am to be removed from the ship, Commander?" She then asked, voice a little hoarse from disuse, not having spoken to anybody at all since she had been dragged here to replace her previous accommodation within the medical bay.
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 25-Aug-20 10:14 PM
He nodded, and gave a quiet sigh. A'aehrel was somebody who meant a lot to him, the two had gotten on well together when she had first came aboard and she really meant something special to him, when they had first fought it had torn him apart, it hurt an incredible amount to fight with the woman he knew he had come to care so much about... And then recently the two had began to rekindle their friendship, working towards perhaps getting things back to normal. And now this, she was being ripped away from him again with little chance of him ever seeing her again. "You would be correct, Commander. We're arrived back at earth again, you're being transferred out of our care."
6
7
5
Captain Syrezeaju 25-Aug-20 10:24 PM
At that she flickered open her other eye, taking a moment to blink against the light before her eyes adjusted. How she yearned for the grunginess of an old Tal Shiar vessel... And how she yearned to not yearn for such a thing. Contradiction after contradiction, conflict after conflict. That was all her life had become. She settled her gaze upon the Aenar before her. How amusing it was that he was framed against the light to create such a silhouette, all but hiding his face in shadow as he delivered the news. Of course she had been well aware that she was going to have to leave. In a very un-Vulcan-like fashion she had been opting to ignore that fact. How sad it was that the one person she had tried to speak to - the first person she had been friends with - would be the one to tell her that she had to leave. It... Oh, gods. There it was; a jolt of distaste, no not distaste, frustration, no not... Not... Upset, and sadness, and complete bloody desolation- She didn't like it. Nor, it seemed, could she push the feeling aside. "...Thank you, Commander." Her external visage was entirely neutral as always, the perfect façade. "Might as I enquire as to where I am being transferred?"
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 25-Aug-20 10:31 PM
The aenar could sense the emotions coming from the woman, glad she was probably as upset as he was about her departure, at least it showed she felt the same as he did about the status of their relationship. She had come to forgive him for what he did and had accepted him as a friend again... And that only seemed to make it even harder to continue. If she hated his guts at least he wouldn't feel so attached to her. At least not as much as before. "Currently to Starfleet security. You'll be court martialled and then to wherever they decide to send you. It'll all be decided at your trial. I thought it be best to inform you of what was to happen, both as your Chief of Security... and as your friend."
Captain Syrezeaju 25-Aug-20 10:41 PM
"Your efforts to inform me of this are appreciated," came her reply, smooth as always and concealed beneath countless lies. She knew there was no hiding from him, though. He was an aenar. It was quite literally impossible, so why was she trying? Why did she even care? "I presume that you are here to let me out so I can be handed over to Security?" It was not as if she could leave if they kept her here within the confines of the brig... Or maybe they could, considering that you could beam someone out of a brig cell - if authorised, that was. It was largely only used to transport a prisoner to another facility or perhaps to a medical bay if something went wrong. Maybe they were going to use a transporter beam to send her straight back planetside. How vile that would be... And how frustrating. Imagine knowing that your yacht is only an ocean or two away and being too busy being imprisoned to go sailing upon it. ...Why was she even thinking about this? What had happened to logical thought processes?
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 25-Aug-20 10:47 PM
Ezran paused for a moment. He obviously could do this right here, but the brig officers would never stop talking about it... He considered his options, and shook his head. If he was going to never see the commander again, he decided he was going to at least say goodbye properly. In private, the two were friends. No matter what she might have done, he wasn't going to let her leave without speaking to her. "Later, yes. But I was hoping I could say goodbye properly, Ideally away from nosy security officers. You are my friend afterall, and it would be very rude to let you leave without saying goodbye..." He moved over and disabled the holo-shield that was over her cell. "Can we talk in my office? Before Starfleet security take you away forever."
6
Captain Syrezeaju 25-Aug-20 11:02 PM
She watched him move, doing that quintessential vulcan eyebrow-quirk at the fact he was lowering the holoshield without another member of security standing by. She had attacked a member of this crew, had she not? Did that not normally equate to extreme security measures being taken in order to prevent her from doing the same again? If she had still had any position of authority aboard this ship then she would have told him off for it, but instead she merely looked confused. "I am willing to converse with you, yes, but does that not violate protocol? I do not believe that you are supposed to let me out unattended, Commander, nor are you supposed to grant me access to any areas of the ship. It would be far more prudent for you to conduct a handover to your colleagues from Starfleet Security as soon as possible."
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 25-Aug-20 11:12 PM
"I don't think you would intentionally hurt me. Plus I can sense your emotions, If you were thinking of doing anything I'd be able to sense it... I'm not going to let you leave without saying goodbye. Starfleet security can have you as soon as we're done talking... But if you wish to object, I'll hand you over right this minute." He took a pair of stasis cuffs from his belt and held them out. "But what I have to say is rather important to me, and I feel I would never fully live with myself if I did not get the chance to talk to you about it."
3
Captain Syrezeaju 25-Aug-20 11:28 PM
It was rather begrudgingly that she held both arms out in front of her in order for him to clip the stasis cuffs around her wrists. She understood that he needed to, but... For one the device was irritating and tended to scratch at her skin, and for two it indicated that there was no trust between the two... But on the other hand it meant that he was still doing his job correctly, something that she had just been internally complaining about. She made no comment on the matter as she followed behind him to the office. And while they walked she could not help but wonder what he had meant by his statement. What exactly was it that he needed to say? That he despised her and was sorry that they had ever attempted to be friends with one another? Perhaps. Or perhaps it would be something completely different, leagues different to what she expected. Who knew..?
Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 25-Aug-20 11:30 PM
The Aenar led the woman quietly out of her cell, and through the rest of the brig, attracting a couple of looks from the fellow security officers. But nobody chose to spoke up. He led her all the way to the #cos’s-office.

SCPO. Kessel Barry BOT 30-Oct-20 01:01 PM

Commander T'Svai 01-Nov-20 08:33 PM
Once at the brig, she took a look at the recently repaired console. Sure, it was fine now in and of itself, but she wanted to check the surrounding area for anything that could cause that kind of damage. She started doing diagnostics.
Commander T'Svai 01-Nov-20 09:59 PM

Otomo 19-Jan-21 09:14 PM
Dom stepped into the brig guard station area, ready to stand guard for several hours, in full uniform, pressed to regulation specs, a stickler for following code.
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 19-Jan-21 09:19 PM

"Greetings, it seems as though there is a new face in security that I have yet to meet." The Android said, her expressions as cold as her synthetic makeup.
Otomo 19-Jan-21 09:23 PM
Dom, once hearing a voice turned, and upon seeing the rank, he straightened to stand at attention. "At your service, ma'am."
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 19-Jan-21 09:26 PM
"Continue working Ensign, I am not here to impede on whatever you are doing." She was suprised at how tense and straightened he became, quirking a brow she spoke. "At ease." She commented.
Otomo 19-Jan-21 09:28 PM
With the order, he immediately went at ease, a distinct posture from his attention which he'd trained at length. Dom slipped behind the console and helped himself to a seat. "Just guard duty. Finished rounds. Some talk of knives going on up in the bar. Knives and alcohol are never a good mix in my estimation, but it seems peaceful... for now."
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 19-Jan-21 09:31 PM
"Very attentive I see. Well make sure your a little relaxed with that kind of stuff. I believe those people are our guests, they would make a fool out of themselves is they started to prance around with their knives. Thats what we are here for yeah?" She said, guard duty was very important to their line of work, however she wasnt a fan to see her officers all tense, it doesnt mix well with their line of work.
Otomo 19-Jan-21 09:33 PM
"Yes ma'am. For everyone's protection, crewman and guest." Dom nodded in agreement. "Last thing we would want would be for people to feel like security couldn't be relied upon." It sounded from remorse like he lived such an experience.
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 19-Jan-21 09:39 PM
"Believe me, that is the worst kind of feeling. Lets hope, that with your work and effort Ensign, we can prevent that from ever happening, hmm?" She said, a little bit of an upper tone cleared end of her sentence, almost sounding like a question was being asked.
Otomo 19-Jan-21 09:40 PM
"Yes ma'am." Dom eased back into his seat. "Have you heard any word as to when we might be deployed? I don't want to admit I'm losing sleep over it, but hard not to think about a situation where I could be in the line of fire at any given moment."
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 19-Jan-21 09:43 PM
"In due time Ensign, but there is nothing to worry about. We will be safe, as long as we have our strength and confidence. We will be fine, nothing to lose sleep over." She said. Even though Jayne never slept, she still understood the importance of getting a good rest. Confused she wanted to comment on the Ensigns sleep schedule. "I cant have our Ensigns sleeping on the job whilst were being attacked hm? Maybe you should get in touch with medical about that dilemma."
Otomo 19-Jan-21 09:47 PM
Dom actually chuckled at the question. "No risk of me falling asleep on the job, ma'am. I appreciate your attitude. Nice to know someone around here will keep clarity and have my six when times get tough."
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 19-Jan-21 09:54 PM
"Well as your superior officer in this case, I cannot take any risks. Even if you assure me that you wont pass out on the Job. Losing sleep, in any regard, is not a good thing. Remember that, oh, and speaking of medical. Looking at my PADD it seems as though you have not gone through your Physical yet. I know you seem to be eager to get to work, but you might want to get that part done and overwith, also tell medical that I said hi while your there, havent seen them in ages." She smirked. "In a professional manner of course." "Another quesiton I have to ask is about your position here. Are you finding it easy to work in and out of different jobs and such? Are you getting along with other officers here?" She inquired, taking note of what responses she got from him.
Otomo 19-Jan-21 10:01 PM
"Understood. I missed the physical, my apologies. I'm sure medical will find I'm in peak condition. A hobby of mine for my off hours." He raised a brow about her comment on medical, but wasn't about to pry into a superior officer's personal business. "Duty is no problem. Like I told the chief, just point me and I'll shoot at the target. As far as the other officers... permission to speak freely?"
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 19-Jan-21 10:17 PM
Quirking a brow, she nodded. "Permission granted." She said, worried as to why the man thought that way about his department. Its not all about shooting and stunning people, there is a lot of sophistication that was involved in it.
Otomo 19-Jan-21 10:21 PM
He sucked in his lower lip as he considered how to phrase this. "The couple of the folk in the department I've met seem, how should I put this, emotionally fragile. Maybe it takes an actual combat experience to build some camaraderie, but as it is I'd be equally afraid the Iconians will offend them to death by talking to them than I would be when they're shooting."
4
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 19-Jan-21 10:25 PM
"Hm, emotionally fragile, those are strong words indeed. Would you mind clarifiying why these people are emotionally fragile exactly? Like what attributes do they show often around you and stuff like that." She said, jotting notes down on her PADD. The officers remarks about them weren't too opitmistic, however Jayne focused more on the emotions, rather than the remarks themselves. (edited)
Otomo 19-Jan-21 10:31 PM
He chuckled at that. "Those actually aren't strong words. Especially for a military outfit. I guess that's a good example of my point in a nutshell. It's only minor experiences at this point, but some woman lost it on me out in the corridor on this deck about a week ago. If she can't handle someone inquiring about 'Cardassian-types' who's never met a Cardassian before, makes me wonder about battle readiness for sure. I've just been keeping my head down and attending to duty since then. 'bout all I can do."
1
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 19-Jan-21 10:40 PM
"From my point of view ensign, those are strong words. Especially when you are referring to one of your fellow officers. There is a certain line of respect, even when you're speaking about other people without them knowing." She paused and took a deep breath in before continuing on with her phrase. "Enlighten me, what exactly do you mean by 'Cardassian-types', it seems as though you put a strong emphasis on that specific phrase." She inquired, wanting to know more about why he emphasized those two specific words. (edited)
Otomo 19-Jan-21 10:41 PM
"I asked permission to speak freely. And I assume you're keeping this in confidence as I wouldn't be here to narc on a fellow unit member. Only a fobbit would do something like that. That's the phrase she lost it over." He shrugged.
3
3
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 19-Jan-21 11:05 PM
"And you still have permission to do so of course. Also, fobbit? I'm sorry for asking, but I don't quite understand what you mean by that term." She asked, intruiged by the officers use of slang. Ensign styles seemed to be well versed in that certain type of speech which to Jayne, was very unique and rather interesting.
Otomo 19-Jan-21 11:07 PM
"Fobbit... you know. It's a play on forward operating base. It's about the chicken officers who try to get out of away missions to hostile situations. I'm starting to think folk here aren't in the fleet but are in some alternate universe civvie office simulation."
Lieutenant Jayne Walsh 19-Jan-21 11:16 PM
"Okay then.." She said, confused still. She hoped that Dominic wasn't trapped inside some army veteran know it all mindset because that clearly wasnt needed there. However, after she finished jotting her notes down she lowered her PADD. "It seems as though we both have some work to do, remember to get your physical in ensign. Make sure you notify them about your loss of sleep, that stuff is important to keep track of." She said, turning one of her heels towards the door, ready to depart the premises and take her duties elsewhere.
Otomo 19-Jan-21 11:17 PM
"Yes, sir." Dominic said, shaking his head and returning to guard duty for the moment.
Planettree 26-Jan-21 01:15 AM
[D] They boarded the Phoenix and walked to the Brig. They of course got a few looks from the officers they passed. After all, it wasn’t every day that someone was walked down the halls in restraints. Once Kennox was inside a cell, the forcefield was brought up.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Jan-21 01:48 AM
He'd expected to see Kennox again, surely. As a doctor, perhaps, serving proudly in Starfleet. Or as an ambassador to the Confederacy, having spent so long among their number. Or, if neither of the previous lay in his destiny, a civilian, a medic perhaps. All noble, honest and befitting of the stout young Denobulan with a not-so-stout heart he knew. This, however? Was not one of the scenarios he envisioned. Nodding to the brig officer at the entrance, he stepped through and came up to Kennox's cell. "Kennox Ephrix. You wished to talk to me."
Planettree 26-Jan-21 01:54 AM
Ciel stepped back when the Commander came in.
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 26-Jan-21 01:55 AM
Having been escorted (or rather marched) through the Phoenix's hallways and to the brig, he was now once again locked away behind the holofield. He had felt the eyes on him as he had been taken here. Some people he recognised, some people he didn't - but either way, he knew that every single one of them must have been judging him in some way or another. The feeling of their gaze upon him made his skin crawl. He hadn't wanted to speak on the way there. Anything he said could be overheard and subsequently judged even more. It was as such that Dunamis walked into an eerie silence in the brig, not even certain if he should speak with Lieutenant Ciel. Kennox had been determined to speak with Dunamis. He had felt as if the Kelpien may well be the only one who could help him. The trust he had between himself and Ensign - or was he a Lieutenant now? - Lieutenant King had been shattered, he had seen it on the station. He didn't think Lieutenant Roode-now-Verne would trust him any more. Commander Dunamis had always been open and understanding - and most of all, he had been kind. When the Denobulan heard the approach of those hooved boots against the tiles of the brig, though, all of the words he wanted to say seemed to simply elude him. It was with a feeling of dread and his heart pounding in his chest that he watched the Kelpien approach. Commander Dunamis hadn't changed a bit. It was if time seemed to have stood still since they had last seen one another. He swallowed thickly and held his hands together, tightly, from where he was stood behind the holofield. "C... C-Commander Dunamis, s-s-sir. It's... It's a p-p-pleasure to s-s-see you. Ag-gain."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Jan-21 02:03 AM
"I wish we could have met again under better circumstances." He knew, for certain, that Kennox thought the same. He only wished that he could've returned the greeting in kind. "And I regret that things have come to such a state. I shall be direct - we are at war, as you surely understand. Time is precious. What exactly did you wish to talk to me about?" (edited)
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 26-Jan-21 02:07 AM
He had already been hesitant, given the circumstances - and that statement from the Commander seemed to shatter his hopes in an instant. He ground his teeth together, eyes suddenly stinging with tears again. His words were ground out, nowhere near the usual pleasant conversational tone that he would employ. "If you're too b-b-busy to speak with me, s-s-sir, then it's fine. I unders-s-stand. 'Time is p-p-precious' and all."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Jan-21 02:13 AM
"I am not."Came the reply. "I am here to listen to you - especially considering that you requested to speak to me in particular. I sense there is something you wish to convey - something of importance. Even if not, I would not turn down an opportunity to speak to someone I consider to be a friend - especially when I have not seen them for quite some time. Therefore..." He took a deep breath. "You have my undivided attention. What's on your mind?" (edited)
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 26-Jan-21 02:42 AM
"I j-j-just... I d-d-don't know, s-s-sir." Shoulders slumped in a sudden defeat, the anger that had been building seeming to vanish in an instant. His mood swings seemed to be dangerous; caring to upset to scared to enraged. "I g-g-guess I just... If I h-h-have to explain everything, s-s-sir, I supposed I wanted to explain it to y-y-you. I think... I think I owe it t-t-to you. Questions answered, and all."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Jan-21 02:46 AM
"How did this begin?" He asked, for a start. The mood swings did not go unnoticed. When this was all over, and the consequences inevitably came, he would have to look at ways and means by which he could possibly get this poor young man some help. Counselling, perhaps, for whatever good that would do.
Planettree 26-Jan-21 02:47 AM
[D] Ciel had made a timely exit after hearing the first few words they spoke to one another. They deserved their privacy.
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 26-Jan-21 02:52 AM
It was with a look of desolation that he watched Ciel leave. The blue-white uniform of medical felt like one of few things that he could trust, and the officer had been nothing but kind to him so far. It had even been to the extent that - just briefly - he had felt like himself while they were conversing. Calling out after him would have been untoward though. Instead he looked back to the Commander, seemingly steeling himself to give a full explanation. "After the f-f-funeral, sir. Admiral Kohl Th'erevan came to s-s-speak to me. He s-s-said that he needed me to help b-b-bring my aunt back. I... I was grieving, s-sir. I was upset, and I was d-d-d-desperate, and I didn't k-know what to do- so I s-said yes."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Jan-21 03:00 AM
*Admiral th'Ereven. Bring back Phenna Ephrix.The feat was impossible. He knew that. He'd seen her - interacted with her in some fashion. The glowing red phoenix. You couldn't just bring back a Q. Right?* "What happened then?" Somehow he dreaded hearing the answer. What if they'd succeeded? And more dreadfully - what if they'd succeeded - and things had gone horribly wrong? (edited)
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 26-Jan-21 03:37 AM
"He had me t-t-travel out to that station. I met Elija Noi. I was sceptical, sir, and I k-k-knew he was bad, but- he had the Tal Shiar t-t-technology. From New Romulus. So I k-k-knew it was all serious and that... That we had a c-c-chance."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Jan-21 03:41 AM
"...did you succeed...?" His expression grew noticeably more tense. Tal Shiar technology. New Romulus. Possibly more. Maybe even section 31 resources. Whatever it was, he definitely did not like the implications.
1
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 26-Jan-21 03:57 AM
Just as the same as before, the dangerously unstable grin that had been offered on the station was now replaced by eyes welling with tears. Previously he had been so proud, but now it felt like he was lost. "Y-Y-Yes, sir. We did."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Jan-21 04:24 AM
Yes, sir. We did. In any other context he might've felt his heart leap with joy. It'd have been a great service; to the Federation and surely to the Alliance as a whole. But in this context? With Noi and the mention of Tal Shiar technology? Somehow, the notion made his blood run cold. "Where is she...?" His voice sounded hoarse. Why did it sound hoarse!?
3
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 26-Jan-21 11:14 AM
The way that the Commander sounded fearful, almost, only created the same reaction in him. Combined with the same question as earlier, it did not take long before his hands were shaking as he wrung them together. Eyes blinked back tears again. "I d-d-don't know, sir. She was h-here earlier; in the other brig, that is. She was s-speaking to me..."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Jan-21 11:35 AM
Either Kennox had taken leave of his senses - or there actually had been an extradimensional entity in the brig with him, and it had vanished into thin air. Lieutenant Ciel had seemed none the worse for wear, though; surely he would have acted much more fearfully had they had such a visitation. "What did she say to you? Were there any of our personnel in there with you at the time?"
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 26-Jan-21 11:43 AM
"The s-security officer was here." Hands kept wringing together faster now: fingers entwining, visible and almost forceful movements seemingly in tandem with his sudden upset. The way he fluctuated was jarring; spiking to anger one moment and then timid and voice small the next. "But when L-Lieutenant Ciel s-s-spoke to me, she left. She's upset that we l-l-lost all of the research, and... And th-that we lost Noi t-too."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Jan-21 11:52 AM
"I see." Phenna Ephrix would surely not have condoned what Kennox had just done. Forgiving and unconditionally loving though she was he knew that she would have drawn the line somewhere. The unholy work they'd been doing was surely that somewhere. It certainly didn't sound like the Phenna Ephrix he knew. Kennox's behavior made him doubt the veracity of his claims even more if anything. Wringing hands, emotional state wildly fluctuating between moments. Something told him that maybe the entire alleged 'revival' had been contrived solely in his mind in his current state. A coping mechanism perhaps. Be that as it may he was not about to put down this idea, this perception of reality, without any degree of proof. That was possibly the worst thing to do in the here and now, never mind the idea of crushing Kennox's hopes. Tal Shiar technology was in play. There might just be a terrifying degree of truth to the claim. "I'm sorry to hear that. What other work were you doing on the station?" (edited)
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 26-Jan-21 11:56 AM
There was no way of him meeting the Commander's gaze any more. How could he when those months ago he had been stopped for doing the same work, trusted with a second chance, and subsequently turned against everyone? "...It was the s-same work as in the uninhabitable decks. I had c-c-clones of Mr. Noi, s-some jem'hadar, I was t-trying another changeling but... they're t-tricky. And I had an undine-breen." He sniffed, voice wavering. "His name was R-R-Rhys, but now he's gone and they're all g-gone..."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Jan-21 12:03 PM
Somehow the Kelpien's expression did not change. No shock, no horror - if anything there was a hint of sympathy to it. Kennox had done it the first time around because he simply wanted friends. That much he knew. He wanted someone to associate with. Noi had given of that freely to him - and played expertly to his insecurities and desperation. "I am sorry about your creations, Kennox. I genuinely am. Their loss is regrettable indeed." Where did they go from here, he thought. Jail for the young man, certainly, possibly a penal colony. Maybe some counselling, a lot of it. Yet he refused to let go of hope, of the chance, no matter how miniscule, that there was light at the end of this dark, dark tunnel he'd chosen to traverse. "You understand why we cannot condone that, I am sure. And why we must do what has to be done." (edited)
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 26-Jan-21 12:09 PM
"I also th-thought you didn't condone k-killing," he whispered quietly, pressing the palms of both hands firmly against his eyes in an attempt to stave away the tears. "The away t-team didn't try to s-save them. They knew the station was going to s-self-destruct. They shot my experiments and k-killed the clones and then didn't t-try to save the others. They were sentient beings, s-s-sir..."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Jan-21 12:18 PM
"Their actions are their own. The captain and I will review the circumstances of the mission and determine if such an action was warranted and proceed accordingly." He answered. That was all they could reasonably do. "Nonetheless I regret that they were lost. I would have loved to see them develop and grow as people myself. Kennox-" He sighed, shaking his head. "-you know that this is not the end. Don't you?" (edited)
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 26-Jan-21 12:26 PM
He snorted at that and shook his head. Turning away, it was only following a slow pace around in a circle that he looked back to the Commander. "Sir. I k-k-k-know it's the end for me. Look at wh-what I did! You don't g-g-get away with that! I knew it was wrong, and I... I d-did it anyway."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Jan-21 12:32 PM
"Perhaps it might be, yes." He studied the young Denobulan as he paced the interior of the cell. "No doubt you will be appropriately dealt with for your actions. Over that I have no say. But keep in mind also that perhaps mercy and compassion might just take precedence. I do not see a criminal in you, Kennox Ephrix. I see someone who is lonely. Longing for companionship and association. I only hope the powers that be can see that." He let the thought hang for a moment. "I don't deny that things seem bleak. To you and admittedly to myself. But I choose to look towards hope, toward kindness. I would like to encourage you to take heart. The universe is not as cruel as it seems." (edited)
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 26-Jan-21 12:37 PM
"I just..." His voice cracked, the sound distinct. It upped a pitch as he was on the verge of tears - proper tears, threatening to spill over. "I j-j-just don't get it! I- I knew it was wrong, and I d-d-did it all anyway. I knew who Mr. N-Noi was and I helped him anyway! And I don't... I d-d-don't understand it, s-s-sir. I don't understand why sh-she told me to w-work with him. Why she t-told me to do all of that research. It was wrong. It was w-wrong and I... I was just a b-bad person again. I'm a c-criminal and I... I don't understand. I just don't understand..."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Jan-21 12:47 PM
He wanted to reach through the force field. Wrap the young man in an embrace, firm, comforting and hopefully warm (ha, possibly not, he didn't have much of that to offer physiology wise) and hold him til he stopped crying and calmed down - and knew that, even if he felt that the universe was against him there was a single point of warmth in his life. An anchor if he so wished, to the larger, kinder universe he could not or would not see. But he couldn't. So he did the next best thing. He knelt down to the young man's eye level. He placed his hand, palm flat, against the force field separating them at a height Kennox could reach, feeling the slight crackle of energy against his skin. The jolt of pain was momentary and in the grander of scheme of things was tiny if it helped. He hoped that Kennox would know how to respond. "That is the past now, Kennox. What has done has been done. All we can do is face the consequences and move on. Who you were is one thing. Who you can be is another, far more significant thing. It is by that notion that I choose to believe that there is hope on the horizon for you. Remember that." (edited)
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 26-Jan-21 01:06 PM
With his head lowered he only just caught the motion of the commander putting his hand to the holofield. it only made him want to cry more - but because of appreciation more than anything. He would have mimicked the motion but, from this side of the holofield, it was designed to hurt -- and it was no secret that he had always been a bit of a wimp anyway. "...You s-said that last time, s-s-sir. I know that it's over. I just... I j-j-just want to know why. Why I did it. Wh-Why she told me to."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Jan-21 01:12 PM
"I can't answer that question, Kennox. I do not know her motivations for doing so - nor can I pretend to be able to ascribe intention to why you did what you did. Only you can answer that part of your queries. As to your future, I remain where I am on the topic." He settled down on the floor, leaving his hand on the forcefield. "That's all. Is there anything else you'd like to talk to me about?"
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 26-Jan-21 01:16 PM
There was a small shake of his head. "N-N-No, sir. ...Just that I'm s-s-sorry. I know it won't f-fix anything, but... I am."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Jan-21 01:22 PM
"I know you are. That much has been apparent throughout our conversation." He removed his hand from the force field and returned it to his side. Never mind that it tingled a little. "And no, it will not. Your actions will." He stood up then, smoothing out his uniform. "From ash to the stars, Kennox Ephrix. I hope the next time we talk it will be under better circumstances."
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 26-Jan-21 01:29 PM
The denobulan tried a very small smile - very difficult, given the circumstances, but if one thing had helped it was the Commander's trust. "Th-Thank you, sir. ...I hope so t-t-too."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 26-Jan-21 01:31 PM
The meeting had to be cut short sometime. He had a memo to write to Syrezeaju and a bridge to watch - and a disturbing possibility to consider. For the time being he exited the brig in silence, following a short, firm nod to Kennox.
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 26-Jan-21 07:51 PM
Capri had stopped just short of the doors to the brig, shaking hard suddenly. Was he even allowed in here? Would they call extra security to make sure he didn't try anything with Kennox like he had the past times he'd been here with a prisoner? He shook off the thought quickly. He was reckless, but he wasn't a monster. Not like--anyway. He wiped his eyes quickly and straightened his uniform jacket, stepping in and looking around. He paused when he saw Kennox in the cell and slowly walked towards it, sitting down on the floor with the PADD in his lap. He just wanted to talk. He was unarmed. And....the betrayed look he had on the station came back to his face before he realised it. What could he say?
Captain Syrezeaju 26-Jan-21 08:02 PM
Kennox had been sat on the floor on the other side of the holofield. Cross-legged, he had taken to idly fidgeting with the sleeves of his lab coat just for something to do. He had always felt proud wearing it - a sign that you were a graduated doctor and all. Now it felt like it was wrong. He watched Copernicus approach, sit down - and then just stare. Understandable, he thought, and made no move to speak either. It seemed that neither of them had the words.
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 26-Jan-21 08:08 PM
Capri looked up towards Kennox and opened his mouth, closing it again. He did this a few times before looking down and staring at the screen of his PADD. When he finally looked uo again, he shook his head and let out a very soft, "Why?"
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 26-Jan-21 08:16 PM
He thought that might have been the question. "I was t-t-told to, sir. Asked to, and then t-t-told to. It was... It was after the f-funeral, sir. Right after."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 26-Jan-21 08:18 PM
"But....why?" He really didn't know how else to ask besides that.
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 26-Jan-21 08:22 PM
"Because I was t-t-told to. Admiral Th'ereven s-s-spoke to me, and... I was upset, I was g-g-grieving and desperate and he s-s-said we could get my aunt back. I j-j-just wanted to help. My d-d-dad had been distraught since the n-n-news. I still don't th-think he's had a day sober since then. I just... W-W-Wanted to put things right. The Admiral took me to w-w-work on the station. Turns out the p-p-person I was going to be working with was M-Mister Noi."
5
5
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 26-Jan-21 08:26 PM
"And you didn't question it when you found out it was Noi? I mean I understand. Death hurts, Kennox. It hurts and it sucks and it feels like your whole world has been shattered but....but death is also necessary. It's a part of our cycle of life, like the seasons or the days."
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 26-Jan-21 08:35 PM
"I know. I know that, I k-k-know that, it's one of the f-f-first things we learn as soon as we g-g-get into the Academy's medical programme. But this was d-d-different. This was a Q."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 26-Jan-21 09:05 PM
"Th--" He stopped and sighed, trying to choose his words carefully, "that doesn't make it any less wrong, Kennox. Even if it was different, wrong is wrong and its wrong for a reason."
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 26-Jan-21 09:09 PM
"I know," he reiterated, drawing the word out in exasperation. "I know! B-B-But I can't change it, c-c-can I? So I've j-j-just got to deal w-w-with it!"
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 26-Jan-21 09:30 PM
"Yes. Like we all do. We have to accept these things. I just....I dont understand...." He trailed off, sounding a little pathetic. He didn't know what to think or even say and didn't to shoot his mouth off like he had in sickbay.
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 26-Jan-21 09:36 PM
"Don't- don't understand w-w-what, sir? Please, I can just... I c-c-can explain. I'll answer whatever y-y-you want to ask."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 26-Jan-21 09:50 PM
"You remember what happened the last time, right? They wanted to take you to prison.....I dont understand any of it, Kennox. I thought you wanted to help people, to be a doctor. Why take the mad scientist route?"
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 26-Jan-21 09:51 PM
"B-B-Because I was t-t-told to, Capri!" He stated again, firmly, obviously exasperated with the constant repeating himself. "I- I don't know why I l-l-listened, and I d-d-don't know why she t-t-told me to, but s-s-she did!"
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 26-Jan-21 10:39 PM
He sighed and raked a hand through his hair, unsure of what else he could say. He wasn't trying to interrogate Kennox after all. "What was in it for you?"
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 26-Jan-21 10:44 PM
"Just... G-G-Getting to do my w-w-work. G-Getting to sp-speak with her."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 26-Jan-21 10:56 PM
"You can still speak with her. Jist because she isn't here physically, doesn't mean she's completely gone. She's still in here," He put his hand over his heart, "And she will never truly be gone as long as you keep her there." His tone had softened and he gave Kennox a sympathetic smile.
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 26-Jan-21 10:57 PM
"N-N-No, sir, you d-d-don't get it." He put his elbows on both knees, rubbing his face with his hands. "W-w-w-e brought her back. S-S-She told me to d-d-do all of this."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 26-Jan-21 11:04 PM
"But it--" He stopped, not sure how to word the next thing he wanted to say. They had brought her back in body. But it wouldn't have been her in mind, that was gone. It wouldn't be the same amd Kemmox had to know that in the back of his mind, right? He opened his mouth again but closed it again. He really had no way to tell Kennox what he was thinking without upsetting him more. "Im sorry, Kennox. I really am."
8
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 26-Jan-21 11:07 PM
"Wh-What are you apologising for? It's- it-s- It's a g-g-good thing." He blinked and looked back again, not understanding. "We- We r-r-resurrected a god, why are you ap-p-pologising?"
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 26-Jan-21 11:15 PM
"Her body, Kennox. You resurrected her body, not her mind." He said softly, looking down at his PADD again. It hurt, he didn't want to say that but he had no choice it seemed.
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 26-Jan-21 11:17 PM
"N-N-No, it's her. S-S-She speaks to me, you d-d-don't get it. She was t-t-telling me to help Mister Noi and s-s-she was encouraging me with those experiments. It's n-n-not a body, it's not a m-m-mortal form, just an energy s-state..."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 26-Jan-21 11:24 PM
"It doesn't strike you a little odd that she would tell you to help a monster like Noi? So many people have had their lives go through the ringer because of him."
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 26-Jan-21 11:29 PM
"I know. I kn-n-know but I didn't unders-s-stand. I didn't realise it was w-w-wrong. Well I mean I did, b-b-b-but- I-" With a groan, he put his face into his hands. "I d-d-don't understand it either."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 26-Jan-21 11:33 PM
"Its okay, Kennox. I mean its not okay but its okay. Except this time I dont know if we can help you like we did last time...not when we're facing a war."
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 27-Jan-21 12:04 AM
There was silence for a good few moments. He seemed distraught, head in his hands. "I k-k-know. I underss-s-stand that. I'm just... G-Going to go with w-whatever happens t-t-to me. They'll probably w-want me in jail. That's okay."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 27-Jan-21 12:05 AM
"Probably, yeah. Im really sorry about all of this. I know at the core of it you had good intentions." He said softly then suddenly because a little worried, "......right?"
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 27-Jan-21 12:06 AM
His tone - already desolate - seemed to darken. "I d-d-don't know. I was just d-doing what I was told. ...I d-don't know what they were going to be used for."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 27-Jan-21 12:33 AM
Capri suddenly looked worried, "Noi used his clones to cause chaos without him facing any actual consequences. The ones in the vats put telepathic attacks on us....especially working with Noi, he was going to use them to do something awful."
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 27-Jan-21 12:49 AM
"He... H-He was also the one who h-h-helped the Tal Shiar torture and u-use her when they attacked Mol'Rihan. I... I was s-s-stupid." His strangely orange eyes settled directly on Capri now, staring at him from the other side from the holofield. They had widened slightly, suddenly fearful. "I was really, r-r-really stupid. Why would s-she... Why would sh-she want me to work with him? To m-make clones for him?"
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 27-Jan-21 01:10 AM
"She wouldn't. I think.....I think maybe Noi took advantage of you. Maybe he somehow found about what you did on the uninhabited deck and so he waited. Took his time, waited for things to calm, waited for a time to exploit and take advantage. And losing Ohenna was the perfect opportunity I think. Because we were all vulnerable, especially those close to her. So he used that. At least thats what it seems like. And if that's the case then.....well that kinda gives you extenuating circumstances." He shrugged and ruffled his hair a little. "Thats only a theory....but it might be worth pursuing if we have to."
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 27-Jan-21 01:23 AM
While listening to the theory he kept shaking his head. Hands ended up over his ears, fingers clawed into his hair. "That c-c-can't be right. Kohl spoke to me. S-S-She's spoken to me. It's t-t-true, I promise..."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 27-Jan-21 01:28 AM
"Kennox, stop it! You're going to hurt yourself!" He jumped and reached a hand out to try and get him to put his down. Instead he ran into the forcefield and bounced back towards the brig officers station. "Forgot that was a thing...but please stop....and think about this logically. Noi was a monster. Phenna was the extreme opposite of him. Why would someone as gentle and compassionate and loving as Phenna want you to get mixed up with a monster?" (edited)
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 27-Jan-21 01:34 AM
There was the distinct image of him flinching at the sound of Capri hitting the holofield and immediately rebounding backwards. At least it made him lower his hands as he frantically looked up in an attempt to work out what had happened. Quiet, he listened. "I d-d-don't know. That's the t-thing. I don't understand any of it anymore."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 27-Jan-21 01:35 AM
He dusted himself off and sat down again, "Its okay, Kennox. I dont think any of us understand right now honestly. And thats okay. But we're gonna try to figure it out." (edited)
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 27-Jan-21 01:49 AM
"O... Okay. Okay. That's... That's all I w-w-want. I just want to understand again. I'm..." He paused, voice cracking. It seemed all he was doing today was this - ending up crying. "I'm s-s-sorry."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 27-Jan-21 02:27 AM
He nodded a little and smiled at Kennox, "Its okay. Im not mad at you." That probably wasn't super helpful but he was trying. "How was it by they way? With the Breen and all, I mean?" He asked, thinking maybe changing the subject would lift Kennoxs spirits a little. (edited)
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 27-Jan-21 02:31 AM
"...It was w-w-weird. They were s-s-strange, but nice sometimes..." There was a little shrug of his shoulders. "But I m-missed home."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 27-Jan-21 02:33 AM
"What was the confederacy like? Was the weather alright? Were....were they welcoming?"
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 27-Jan-21 02:50 AM
"I'm n-not allowed to say everything, because th-they sworn us to secrecy on some stuff, b-but... It was okay. They were w-wary of us because they don't normally s-speak to outsiders properly. They're a closed off s-s-society. But it was okay. V-Very, very c-cold..."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 27-Jan-21 02:54 AM
"Hopefully you had a good coat," He joked, laughing a little weakly.
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 27-Jan-21 11:56 AM

Lt. JG. Copernicus King 27-Jan-21 02:48 PM
"Maybe. Andor would probably a tropical paradise by comparison now."
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 27-Jan-21 02:50 PM
"S-Shame I'm never g-g-going to get to go there... Or anywhere." He muttered quietly before eventually looking back to Capri. "Th-Thank you for speaking t-t-to me. I know you m-must be pretty disappointed."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 27-Jan-21 03:10 PM
He shrugged and nodded slowly, pushing his hair from his eyes. "Im sorry. And I wanted to come see you again anyway, just....under different circumstances." He stood up and stretched, giving Kennox a smile. "I should probably go so you can eat and have some peace. Plus the sec officer back there is burning a hole in my back with their 'I dont trust you' glare."
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 27-Jan-21 03:15 PM
"D-Don't worry, sir. You're not the only one g-getting that glare. But rhan you for s-s-stopping by."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 27-Jan-21 04:09 PM
He smiled and gave Kennox a thumbs up as he stuffed his PADD in his pocket. "True. Keep your head up, okay? Ill try come by again if I get the chance." He gave Kennox another smile before heading towards the door.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 27-Jan-21 05:22 PM
Maggie entered with a soft sigh. Looking to the brig officer with a nod, she hoped they hadn’t recognized her from her two separate times in the brig. She walked towards Kennox’s cell. Slowly looking moving towards him. Before stopping and looking at him from the other side. “Hi, Kennox. It’s good to see you again.” Said Maggie.￼
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 27-Jan-21 05:24 PM
The Denobulan had thought that Copernicus King would likely be the last of his visitors. In truth he had no idea of who still served aboard the Phoenix and who didn't - he had been a little pre-occupied to say the least. Still sat there upon the floor, it was a look of surprise that crossed his features when Maggie arrived. At least it was better than the constant look of guilt or fear. "L-Lieutenant Roode, I d-d-din't expect to see you! I didn't even k-know you were still on board..."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 27-Jan-21 05:27 PM
Maggie smiled as she looked at him, a feeling of ￼ anxiousness deep within her core. What had he been doing with Noi, she hoped beyond hope that he had been manipulated somehow. Even still, she had her ￼guard up. “I uh, got married. It’s ￼Lieutenant Verne now. And I’m probably the only member of the tactical department still left from your time on the ship.” She said, almost wanting to dance around the reason he was in here. She let out a sigh. She would ask. “Kennox. Why were you working with Noi..?”￼
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 27-Jan-21 05:29 PM
He had wanted to give her congratulations but instead found the conversation very swiftly changing direction. The surprised look dulled. At this rate he might as well record himself giving an explanation and hit the play button whenever someone asked. "I was asked to, ma'am. T-t-told to. There was a wh-w-whole thing after the f-f-funeral, it's a long s-story..."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 27-Jan-21 05:30 PM
Maggie raised an eyebrow as she looked at him. Nodding softly. “Right okay. So, Noi’s boss then? They told you to do it? And...working with clones? What did they have you doing with clones?”
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 27-Jan-21 05:33 PM
"No, no, there's... A wh-whole other story. After the f-f-funeral this admiral came and s-spoke to me, Admiral Kohl Th'Erevan. Or Th'Everan? I c-c-can't get it right... He knew I was upset, and d-d-desperate, and... Unstable, I kn-know. He told me that if we w-w-worked together we could-" He paused, gulping. Before when all of this had happened it had been a complete and utter blur. Now, however, the clarity of it all had left him so confused. "B-Bring Admiral Ephrix back. So I agreed. I f-f-felt I had to - everything was w-w-wrong. And so I went with him to this s-station, and it was where M-Mister Noi was w-w-w-working."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 27-Jan-21 05:37 PM
Maggie looked￼ dumbfounded for a ￼ moment. Bring back Phenna, that sounded impossible? She looked at him, worry in her voice. “Kennox..Phenna was Q, sure. But she’s dead? I can understand maybe getting her a body? But...what about a consciousness? How were you going to put that in her body...?”￼
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 27-Jan-21 05:41 PM
"No, No, not- n-n-not like that. Her b-body vanished. It was n-n-never found, and it's because it- disintigrated. Qs d-d-don't have mortal forms but s-s-she did. And when she d-d-died, it was because of it. But a Q exists b-because of their energy state - and we had s-s-seen that when the Tal Shiar t-t-tried to take New Romulus - so... We used their t-t-technology to t-t-try to harness it again. And- the others d-d-don't believe me, Lieutenant. But it w-w-worked."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 27-Jan-21 05:44 PM
Maggie looked at Kennox with a shocked look on her face. How...did it work. “How? How did you. How do you even know Kennox? Is her consciousness somewhere? Does she even want to be alive...?”
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 27-Jan-21 05:45 PM
He groaned at the way Maggie's expression suddenly shifted. Why was it that people thought he had done wrong?! "She's f-f-fine, Lieutenant, honest! S-s-she speaks to me, she t-t-told me to keep working with Noi, I d-d-don't know why but it worked I p-p-promise!"
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 27-Jan-21 05:49 PM
Maggie looked shocked again, with an almost incredulous look on her face. Her hands began to shake, only for her to steady them. “Phenna and Noi couldn’t be more different from each other. Why would she ￼ encourage you to work with him.” Then a thought crossed her hand. There had been another version of her in Italy. The different universe version that had been controlling their Phenna. ￼She decided to keep that thought to herself￼￼ for now.
Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 27-Jan-21 05:55 PM
"I... I d-d-don't know." Shoulders slouched a little bit more. It had been something he had been questioning consistently throughout the day and no matter who he spoke to there had been no logical answer yet. "I d-d-don't know. I didn't think about it then, b-b-because I was just... I was just s-so ecstatic it had w-w-worked. I wasn't thinking s-s-straight. But now that- now that it's all over? Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 27-Jan-21 05:58 PM

Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 27-Jan-21 06:02 PM

Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 27-Jan-21 06:08 PM

I fell off a cliff with her, Pasto Nix had to do some techoshit to beam ￼￼us up. Then she uh, died in the transporter room when I tried to restrain her. Then she took over Commander Dune’s body. Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 27-Jan-21 06:16 PM

Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 27-Jan-21 06:17 PM

Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 27-Jan-21 06:20 PM

Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 27-Jan-21 06:28 PM

Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 27-Jan-21 06:32 PM

Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 27-Jan-21 06:54 PM

It was a sudden motion - eyes snapping shut in a distinct grimace, palms of his hands being pressed to his eyes only a moment later as if in an attempt to stave away the pain. His entire body had gone rigid, stuck there in that position as he gasped out in pain.

Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 27-Jan-21 07:12 PM
When he looked up again the colour had drained from his face. It only took a second for him to try to look away or block out the light again, one hand moving, the other refusing to Orange eyes welled with tears; one pupil dilated, the other constricted. His expression had turned terrified, wide-eyed. When he tried to speak it came out slurred, one corner of his mouth not moving- and slowly, a clear liquid, tinged with red, began to drip from his nose and ears. "L-L-Lieute-t-t-tenant V-V-Verne? Ensign Kennox Ephrix BOT 27-Jan-21 07:25 PM

Lt. Cmdr. Ezran Ch'evhalen 27-Jan-21 07:27 PM

Lieutenant Mino 27-Jan-21 07:32 PM
The nurse had arrived right behind ciel, medical kit in one hand and tricorder in the other it would be pretty useless to try and do anything from here they’d just be wasting time, but she did perform a tricorder scan while ciel contacted, sickbay presumably.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 27-Jan-21 07:33 PM

Captain Syrezeaju 27-Jan-21 07:35 PM
[D] The tricorder's readings seemed to be difficult to determine, continually changing. Brain aneurysm, subarachnoid hemorrhagic stroke, the rapid shutting down of brain function - it seemed like everything was spiralling at once. Only a moment later there was the distinct sound of a smack as the young medic's head hit off the bench, hard - and then again, and again, convulsing.
Planettree 27-Jan-21 07:38 PM

Lt. JG. Zulola Jex 27-Jan-21 07:38 PM
